story:
About me!

Helloooo! I’m Sophie

In August I am off on an awesome trip to Uganda. I am graduating from Southampton Solent University having studied Media Culture and Production (waiting for results so fingers crossed!) In my spare time I love creating digital media and I never stop dancing. I also enjoy cooking. When I found this opportunity advertised I could not believe my luck as it combines my love for digital media with the chance to help primates and travel at the same time. Ever since I was little and began watching programmes such as Planet Earth I always knew I wanted to create media for awareness of animals which are facing great danger. This is a great step in the right direction!

The Adventure

The trip is with a great not-for-profit organization called The Great Primate Handshake who produces digital content to help with the preservation of Primates whilst teaching people like me new skills in media. We will be going into primate sanctuaries and working closely with the staff there to raise awareness through our work. We will be supporting several primate organisations across Uganda and working in locations such as  Kibale Forest to observe important eco-tourism projects.

All of this is made possible by the use of an overland vehicle which enables us to travel across Uganda for the month we are out there.

The Money Bit

As I have to fund this trip I would be so grateful if you could donate some pennies to enable me to do this.

The trip itself costs £1500. This covers accommodation, food, transport once there and production equipment. I also have to fund the cost of the plane tickets, vaccinations and anything I might need on the trip. (Which is about the same amount of money again.) I am going into my local schools to give presentations and raise money through a mufti day and cake sale. I also have a few other local fundraising events up my sleeve. However you can also donate on here. You See that button that says ‘contribute now’, Yep that’s right, the pink one… click it to donate. (go on you know you want to ;-) )  I would LOVE to raise extra so I can donate it to the organization as they do a great job and run by former volunteers.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and thank you for any donations. I am SO greatful!

Sophie :-)

story:
The Goal

Hey Everyone, My name is Michael. I’m the creator of the Container Project. The container project takes used shipping containers and recycles them into beautiful modern homes.

After a home is constructed it is sold to build two more homes. For every two homes constructed, one container studio will be donated to a family in need.

Imagine the container project as a big BOGO ( buy one give one) We build two container homes, sell them and then build a third to give away. This continues to compound, building more sustainable architecture and distributing more homes to families in need.

With Your Help 

Your Pledges will allow us to build our first container home. This home will feature 6 High Cube Shipping Containers roughly coming out to 2000sqft. It will be a contemporary complex with split level living space. It will be located in Southern California within a 20 mile radius of Los Angeles, California. Your funds will go into purchasing the land and remaining five 40ft high cube shipping containers. 

(5) 40ft High Cube containers 40Lx9’6Lx8W-$26000

4000-8000sqft buildable lot (includes water, electricity, gas and septic) $13000+ My $12,000 which is in a 95,000 land/construction loan. 

By backing the project or simply sharing it with others, you will be helping the first of many sustainable creations come to life along with helping numerous families once again have shelter. Everyone that participates will also have the ability to directly contact me with ideas and insight on current projects. The more ideas the better the project!

If our goal isn't reach, don't worry. I will keep working to get the project going. We will downsize the Container house to 5 containers not 6, and the plot of land will be smaller. 

Without your funds we will not be able to start our project, remember any amount helps and is greatly appreciated. Everybody who pledges will get something!

My Story 

I got my inspiration for the Container Project when I worked at the Los Angeles County Muesum of Art(LACMA). While I worked at LACMA, I would walk by their ticketing booths every morning and admire the fact that they were constructed from shipping containers. During my lunch breaks, I would sketch out home designs made entirely from containers. This progressed into 3D renderings and finally I built up the courage to start my own company. With over 10 years of art and design experience and a love for restorations, I have the ability to execute a project of this magnitude.

I have restored 6 classic cars from a 1973 Dodge Charger to a 1985 Lotus Esprit and completed 1000's of pieces of art from mixed media to pen and ink drawings. The task of taking inactive shipping containers and recycling them into beautiful homes is what I was meant to do. I will be working with a skilled architect and a great fabrication company during the first build. This will ensure that everything is done properly and the home will pass the strictest of California regulations.

 

Our Build

For our build we will be using 6 retired shipping containers. This home will set a standard for green architecture. If funded, the project can be constructed as soon as February of 2013. After the home is constructed it will immediately be sold and the profit from the project will fund two more builds! Each build will embody the surrounding land and build awareness for the many uses of cargo containers.

Why Participate? 

More than 300,000,000 containers are rusting away in shipping yards all around the world. These containers have so much more potential than sitting around in shipping yards and by helping us, you will be taking 6 of these containers out of shipping yards and watching the structure come to life on our website.

After the build you will see two new projects blossom from the profit of the first. Along with the two new builds you will get to be part of the donation of a homes to a family in need. Everyone who participates will have their name on a card going to this family. 

Used containers are not very expensive and can be modified into a home very quickly. The process of building a container home takes roughly one quarter the time of a traditional home and saves over 50 trees from being cut down.

Container homes have minimal site waste because wood isn't a crucial part of the construction. Think of them as big LEGO pieces, each fitting together seamlessly, creating a strong steel structure.  

Container structures aren't anything new. Many homes have been built from shipping containers, with the most impressive build being a 120 room travel lodge in England. 

Sustainability 

For every home build, 5-10 containers are being removed from a shipping yard and recycled into a home. Along with the recycling of the containers 50-100+ trees are being saved by constructing the home with containers opposed to wood. 

Most of the containers will feature solar power and some will even be LEED certified. We will also try to pick up sponsors for energy efficient appliances like laundry machines and dishwashers. 

I will be building most of the furniture to go along with the house, which will be constructed sustainably. 

Along With recycling the containers, we will be recycling a car to go along with each home. Restoring a car back to its glory causes creates less waste then manufacturing a new one. All cars we restore will be non-running and be brought back to life!

You will be able to track the progress of each build through our website www.Containers4.me. There will be live cams on site, photo journals blogs, and a gallery of all of our designs. 

 

Rewards

PLEDGE $2 OR MORE

Your Name will be memorialized on the "Skywall". A wall in the home will all the names that made the project happen.

Estimated Delivery: Feb 2013

PLEDGE $15 OR MORE

A Universal Stylus to personalize your Skywall signature. This E-signature will be put on the "Skywall". Stylus compatible with most smartphone's and tablets.

Estimated Delivery: Sep 2012

PLEDGE $25 OR MORE

Universal Stylus to have your very own signature on the Skywall. With high-res image taken of your name on the wall and image of the completed house.( images JPG)

Estimated Delivery: Feb 2013

PLEDGE $50 OR MORE

Container Project t-shirt( comes in black, white, grey)+Universal Stylus to have your E-signature put on Skywall with photo of signature and completed house(JpG)

Estimated Delivery: Feb 2013

PLEDGE $99 OR MORE

Build your own container house! Includes floorplans for the container house in (PDF) These are architect approved floorplans to build a 6 container home at roughly 2000sqft.Also will get your name on Skywall

Estimated Delivery: Aug 2012

PLEDGE $125 OR MORE

My original drawings that inspired the container project + google sketchup designs and floorplans printed on 8x11 photopaper and mailed to your address. Name on Skywall.

Estimated Delivery: Aug 2012

PLEDGE $179 OR MORE

Original Drawings+Designs and floorplans printed out and shipped in sleek aluminum briefcase. Name on Skywall. ( International shipping charges apply)

Estimated Delivery: Nov 2012

PLEDGE $249 OR MORE

"Contained" Container artwork completed by me. 3 Painting designs will be available. Size will be 36x48 on canvas. Includes Stylus and Name on Skywall. ( International shipping charges apply)

Estimated Delivery: Dec 2012

PLEDGE $999 OR MORE

A plaque with your name on one of the six containers. framed photo of plaque sent to you. With name on Skywall(stylus)+ t-shirt

Estimated Delivery: Feb 2013

PLEDGE $5,900 OR MORE

One week stay in home once it's completed, includes food, and rental car. Name on Skywall.

Estimated Delivery: Apr 2013

PLEDGE $9,000 OR MORE

My 1973 Jensen Healey Shipped directly to you( California) Out of state/country will have shipping fee. Name on wall included, with floorplans (PDF)

Estimated Delivery: Sep 2013

story:
Help Allison Restore Yosemite!

My name is Allison. I'm 8 years old. I live in California. I'm on a mission to help Yosemite.

I've started training with my dad and raising money for Muir's March on July 31 to August 3, 2013. Muir's March is a backpacking adventure in Yosemite to raise funds to bring Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite back to life.

A long time ago people put a dam on the river and flooded this part of Yosemite under 300 feet of water. I want to tell people about this wonderful, wild place. I hope to see it fixed during my life.

The closest I have been to camping and hiking in the mountains is sleeping in our tent in the backyard. I am a little scared about raccoons because they have sharp teeth.

Our goal is to raise $4,800 that will go towards the work to restore Hetch Hetchy Valley. That is $16 for every foot of water that has flooded the Valley.

If I don't reach the fundraising goal my dad and I will not be able to hike Muir's March this summer, but will donate all funds raised to Restore Hetch Hetchy.

- Allison

A Note From Allison's Dad

One hundred years ago San Francisco, California launched the modern environmental movement by demanding to use the Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite National Park as a reservoir. The unsuccessful fight to protect this unique ecosystem in the crown jewel of America’s national park system gave birth to the Sierra Club, the National Park Service and an environmental ethic amongst rank and file Americans.

The battle to restore this extraordinary place comes at a moment in time when we must re-evaluate all aspects of human impact on the environment. Since the Civil War more than 50% of habitat in the lower 48 states has been bulldozed. 

If we are serious about protecting the poor and future generations from the impacts of climate change we must launch a comprehensive ecological restoration effort. Where better to start than in Yosemite National Park?

Check out our great perks below and thank you for helping our efforts to restore Yosemite.

- Tom

Picture shows what Hetch Hetchy Valley could look like in Spring of 2050. Right now it is under 300 feet of water.

 What You Get - PERKS!!!

We would be honored to have your support as we march across Yosemite to Restore Hetch Hetch Valley. We have some great perks for you!

$1 - Virtual Fist Bump

Get a virtual shout out on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn from us. We would love it if you could return the favor and promote our campaign on your social media. Bumps usually happen within 24-28 hours.

Even better, like and follow Tom on Facebok and Twitter and we'll "tag" you too!

$10 - SUPPORTER LEVEL: Sticker

Show your support with a Restore Hetch Hetchy sticker!

  • Printed with water-based inks on EarthFirst PLA white 100% corn stock (not "stalk")
  • Sticker measures 4" high x 2 " wide with rounded corners

Larger Image

Plus: Virtual Fist Bump!

$25 - FRIEND LEVEL: Scarf & Postcard

1) Embroidered Scarf: Traditional, comfortable, and warm; everyone needs a soft, lightweight, easy-packing, easy-wearing microfleece scarf.

  • Made of the softest 100% polyester microfleece
  • Machine washable
  • Measures 12" x 58" (gives you lots of coverage)
  • Comes in black with the Restore Hetch Hetchy Logo embroidered near the hem

Larger Image

2) Postcard: Thank You Photo Postcard from Allison and Tom. If you are lucky, Allison might draw you a cute picture, too (smiling raccoon?).

Plus: Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$50 - ACTIVIST LEVEL A: 2 Books

2 Different Books: 1 Signed Paperback & 1 Digital

1) The Battle over Hetch Hetchy: America's Most Controversial Dam and the Birth of Modern Environmentalism, by Robert W, Righter [Paperback]

Book will come to you signed by the author, Robert W. Righter

In the wake of the devastating 1906 earthquake and fire, the city of San Francisco desperately needed reliable supplies of water and electricity. Its mayor, James Phelan, pressed for the damming of the Tuolumne River in the newly created Yosemite National Park, setting off a firestorm of protest. For the first time in American history, a significant national opposition around... (more)

Larger Image

2) The Yosemite, by John Muir [Digital Copy]

In the spring of 1869, John Muir was looking for means of support to fund his explorations of California’s Central Valley region. A ranch owner offered him a job herding sheep in the Sierra Nevada. As he explored the region, he jotted down his keen observations of the scenic countryside, and he eventually became a guide for some of Yosemite’s most famous visitors, including Ralph Waldo Emerson. Muir documented these experiences in The Yosemite, first published in 1912. It is at once a vivid, accurate description of the land and a passionate homage to nature.

Larger Image

Plus: Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$50 - ACTIVIST LEVEL B: Shirt and Book

One T-Shirt and One Digital Book

1) Either one 100% Organic Ladies' or one 100% Organic Mens' Cotton T-Shirt. Made by Econscious, the shirt has these Special Features:

  • Made of 100% Organic Cotton ring-spun jersey; 4.4 oz/yd2 (150gsm)
  • An organic cotton/spandex "1x1 rib neck"
  • Comes in color White with the Restore Hetch Hetchy Logo printed LARGE on the front center chest

   

Women's Larger Image     Men's Larger Image

2) The Yosemite, by John Muir [Digital Copy]

In the spring of 1869, John Muir was looking for means of support to fund his explorations of California’s Central Valley region. A ranch owner offered him a job herding sheep in the Sierra Nevada. As he explored the region, he jotted down his keen observations of the scenic countryside, and he eventually became a guide for some of Yosemite’s most famous visitors, including Ralph Waldo Emerson. Muir documented these experiences in The Yosemite, first published in 1912. It is at once a vivid, accurate description of the land and a passionate homage to nature.

Larger Image

Plus: Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$100 - STAR LEVEL A: Photo Book

What Would John Muir Say? takes you on a visual journey through John Muir's remaining natural landscapes. This oversized book  (12" x 15") explores some of Muir's insightful thoughts and observations about the glorious world he celebrated. With 82 pages pages of stunning photographs, this book offers a wonderful introduction to the humorous, poetic musing of this great American hero.

Larger Image

Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump.

$100 - STAR LEVEL B: Patagonia Hoodie

Embroidered Patagonia Hoodie: 80% Organic Cotton / 20% Recycled Polyester Full Zip Hoodie. Specify size when ordering (x-small, small, medium, large, x-large, 2x-large). 

Made by Econscious, the sweatshirt has these Special Features:

  • Made or 80% Organic Cotton - 20% recycled polyester (300 gsm), enzyme washed
  • Neck seam is clean finished with organic cotton woven tape
  • Double needle cover-stitched seams
  • Cotton/spandex cuff and hem rib
  • YKK brass zipper
  • Comes in color Black with the Restore Hetch Hetchy Logo embroidered on the chest
  • Unisex

Larger Image

Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$200 CHAMPION LEVEL: Microfleece Patagonia Jacket

Either one Ladies' El Cap Jacket or one Mens' Micro Fleece Jacket by Patagonia. With Patagonia, you buy into their wonderful "sustainability", recyclability, & "1% for the Planet" mission. Both are embroidered with the Restore Hetch Hetchy logo.

Both Jackets have these Special Features:

  • It leads a 'double life' - in the winter it's a wonderful insulating layer / as the temperature warms it's a wonderful lightweight jacket
  • Moisture wicking performance
  • Quick drying
  • Keeps you warm even when wet
  • It feels great and buttery soft against your skin
  • Full zip for 'ease of wear'
  • Embroidered with the Hetch Hetchy logo on the chest
  • Color Choice: Black or Navy Blue

   

Women's Larger Image     Men's Larger Image

Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$500 - HERO PACKAGE

1) Hetch Hetchy Panorama Print - 10 x 24 paper mounted to 13 x 30

Image created digitally and printed on Epson archival inkjet printers (Epson Stylus Pro 3800), using Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl paper. All prints are corner mounted to acid-free boards and over-matted with acid-free mats, and hand signed by photographer David Best.

Larger Image

2) Annual Pass:America The Beautiful

This National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass is your ticket to more than 2,000 federal recreation sites. A pass covers entrance and standard amenity fees for a driver and all passengers in a personal vehicle at per vehicle fee areas (or up to four adults at sites that charge per person). Good for 1 year.

Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

$1,000 - LEGEND PACKAGE

1) Hetch Hetchy Panorama Print - 13 x 30 paper mounted to 18 x 40

Image created digitally and printed on Epson archival inkjet printers (Epson Stylus Pro 3800), using Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl paper. All prints are corner mounted to acid-free boards and over-matted with acid-free mats, and hand signed by photographer David Best.

Larger Image

2) The Wapama Stroll

Meet up with Allison & Tom as they finish Muir's March August 3, 2013 at O’Shaughnessy Dam! This is a 1-day hike, six-mile out-and-back, from O’Shaughnessy Dam to Wapama Falls. Hikers who prefer a shorter route can turn back at any point.

The Wapama Stroll is perfect for families and friends of all ages. This hike includes two nights of camping, a specially prepared gourmet barbecue on Friday night and the Restoration Festival on August 3. The 6-mile round-trip self-paced hike follows the northern rim of Hetch Hetchy Valley and shows firsthand the impact of the reservoir.

Please message us for more details, if needed.

Plus: National Parks Pass, Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

No Perk Option - Tax Deductible
Or, if you prefer to make a tax deductible donation with no perks, please visit our Muir's March Donation Page.

For Our International Supporters: please add $10 to your pledge to account for shipping costs. Also, for the $1,000 Legendary Package perk of The Wapama Stroll, you will be responsible for transportation to and from Hetch Hetchy in Yosemite National Park.

 

How You Can Help!

Buy a Perk! After that....

1. Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media and ask your friends to help!

2. Connect with Restore Hetch Hetchy on social media

        

3. Watch and talk about the Dam Nation Film when in comes out in Winter, 2013.

 

More Info: The Work to Restore Hetch Hetchy Valley

The Hetch Hetchy Valley was described by John Muir as “one of nature’s rarest and most precious mountain temples.” The pristine Tuolumne River flowed along the valley floor, surrounded by flowered meadows and ancient forests which teemed with bears and bobcats, rushes and eagles. Hetch Hetchy Valley was considered one of the most unique and diverse ecosystems in the world.

Initially protected by the establishment of Yosemite National Park, in 1913 the city of San Francisco won congressional approval to build the O’Shaughnessy Dam which buried this extraordinary wilderness valley under 300 feet of water. Although John Muir was unsuccessful in preventing this from happening, his rigorous campaign resulted in the creation of an international environmental conservation movement.

Modern engineering advances afford us the opportunity to remove the reservoir and create one of the most ambitious and exciting environmental restoration projects in human history. As a living laboratory, Hetch Hetchy will advance the science of restoration by providing biologists, ecologists and botanists from all over the world with the chance to apply cutting-edge science to re-establishing lost habitats.

Soon after the valley is drained and the valley floor becomes exposed, Hetch Hetchy could also serve as a classroom for teachers, students and volunteers to experience restoration first hand, with tours for the public to learn about the restoration efforts and the area’s wildlife.

Within five years, native grasses and wildlife would begin to reappear as the Tuolumne River reclaimed its original channel. Willows and alders would quickly return to its banks and, soon after, Ponderosa pines and oak woodlands would begin to take root. As habitat restored itself, large numbers of animals would migrate home and the twin of Yosemite Valley would re-emerge in the light of the 21st century.

Families from around the world will be able to return to Hetch Hetchy Valley year after year to witness a national treasure coming back to life.

A restored Hetch Hetchy Valley will result in:

  • The re-creation of 9 miles of the “wild and scenic” Tuolumne River
  • The regeneration of 3 square miles of extraordinary wilderness
  • The restoration of habitat for thousands of animal and plant species
  • The creation of miles of hiking trails and numerous camp sites
  • The establishment of an international classroom for restoration scientists

Information from www.hetchhetchy.org

 

"Energy and persistence conquer all things."

- Benjamin Franklin
story_txt:
Help Allison Restore Yosemite!
My name is Allison. I'm 8 years old. I live in California. I'm on a mission to help Yosemite.
I've started training with my dad and raising money for Muir's March on July 31 to August 3, 2013. Muir's March is a backpacking adventure in Yosemite to raise funds to bring Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite back to life.
A long time ago people put a dam on the river and flooded this part of Yosemite under 300 feet of water. I want to tell people about this wonderful, wild place. I hope to see it fixed during my life.
The closest I have been to camping and hiking in the mountains is sleeping in our tent in the backyard. I am a little scared about raccoons because they have sharp teeth.
Our goal is to raise $4,800 that will go towards the work to restore Hetch Hetchy Valley. That is $16 for every foot of water that has flooded the Valley.
If I don't reach the fundraising goal my dad and I will not be able to hike Muir's March this summer, but will donate all funds raised to Restore Hetch Hetchy.
- Allison
A Note From Allison's Dad
One hundred years ago San Francisco, California launched the modern environmental movement by demanding to use the Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite National Park as a reservoir. The unsuccessful fight to protect this unique ecosystem in the crown jewel of America’s national park system gave birth to the Sierra Club, the National Park Service and an environmental ethic amongst rank and file Americans.
The battle to restore this extraordinary place comes at a moment in time when we must re-evaluate all aspects of human impact on the environment. Since the Civil War more than 50% of habitat in the lower 48 states has been bulldozed. 
If we are serious about protecting the poor and future generations from the impacts of climate change we must launch a comprehensive ecological restoration effort. Where better to start than in Yosemite National Park?
Check out our great perks below and thank you for helping our efforts to restore Yosemite.
- Tom
Picture shows what Hetch Hetchy Valley could look like in Spring of 2050. Right now it is under 300 feet of water. 

 What You Get - PERKS!!!
We would be honored to have your support as we march across Yosemite to Restore Hetch Hetch Valley. We have some great perks for you!
$1 - Virtual Fist Bump
Get a virtual shout out on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn from us. We would love it if you could return the favor and promote our campaign on your social media. Bumps usually happen within 24-28 hours. Even better, like and follow Tom on Facebok and Twitter and we'll "tag" you too!

$10 - SUPPORTER LEVEL: Sticker
Show your support with a Restore Hetch Hetchy sticker!

Printed with water-based inks on EarthFirst PLA white 100% corn stock (not "stalk")
Sticker measures 4" high x 2 " wide with rounded corners

Larger Image
Plus: Virtual Fist Bump!
$25 - FRIEND LEVEL: Scarf & Postcard
1) Embroidered Scarf: Traditional, comfortable, and warm; everyone needs a soft, lightweight, easy-packing, easy-wearing microfleece scarf.

Made of the softest 100% polyester microfleece
Machine washable
Measures 12" x 58" (gives you lots of coverage)
Comes in black with the Restore Hetch Hetchy Logo embroidered near the hem

Larger Image
2) Postcard: Thank You Photo Postcard from Allison and Tom. If you are lucky, Allison might draw you a cute picture, too (smiling raccoon?).
Plus: Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!
$50 - ACTIVIST LEVEL A: 2 Books
2 Different Books: 1 Signed Paperback & 1 Digital
1) The Battle over Hetch Hetchy: America's Most Controversial Dam and the Birth of Modern Environmentalism, by Robert W, Righter [Paperback]
Book will come to you signed by the author, Robert W. Righter
In the wake of the devastating 1906 earthquake and fire, the city of San Francisco desperately needed reliable supplies of water and electricity. Its mayor, James Phelan, pressed for the damming of the Tuolumne River in the newly created Yosemite National Park, setting off a firestorm of protest. For the first time in American history, a significant national opposition around... (more)

Larger Image
2) The Yosemite, by John Muir [Digital Copy]
In the spring of 1869, John Muir was looking for means of support to fund his explorations of California’s Central Valley region. A ranch owner offered him a job herding sheep in the Sierra Nevada. As he explored the region, he jotted down his keen observations of the scenic countryside, and he eventually became a guide for some of Yosemite’s most famous visitors, including Ralph Waldo Emerson. Muir documented these experiences in The Yosemite, first published in 1912. It is at once a vivid, accurate description of the land and a passionate homage to nature.

Larger Image
Plus: Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!
$50 - ACTIVIST LEVEL B: Shirt and Book
One T-Shirt and One Digital Book
1) Either one 100% Organic Ladies' or one 100% Organic Mens' Cotton T-Shirt. Made by Econscious, the shirt has these Special Features:

Made of 100% Organic Cotton ring-spun jersey; 4.4 oz/yd2 (150gsm)
An organic cotton/spandex "1x1 rib neck"
Comes in color White with the Restore Hetch Hetchy Logo printed LARGE on the front center chest
   
Women's Larger Image       Men's Larger Image
2) The Yosemite, by John Muir [Digital Copy]

As he explored the region, he jotted down his keen observations of the scenic countryside, and he eventually became a guide for some of Yosemite’s most famous visitors, including Ralph Waldo Emerson. Muir documented these experiences in The Yosemite, first published in 1912. It is at once a vivid, accurate description of the land and a passionate homage to nature.

Larger Image
Plus: Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!

What Would John Muir Say? takes you on a visual journey through John Muir's remaining natural landscapes. This oversized book  (12" x 15") explores some of Muir's insightful thoughts and observations about the glorious world he celebrated. With 82 pages pages of stunning photographs, this book offers a wonderful introduction to the humorous, poetic musing of this great American hero.

Larger Image
Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump.

Either one Ladies' El Cap Jacket or one Mens' Micro Fleece Jacket by Patagonia. With Patagonia, you buy into their wonderful "sustainability", recyclability, & "1% for the Planet" mission. Both are embroidered with the Restore Hetch Hetchy logo. Both Jackets have these Special Features:

It leads a 'double life' - in the winter it's a wonderful insulating layer / as the temperature warms it's a wonderful lightweight jacket

Image created digitally and printed on Epson archival inkjet printers (Epson Stylus Pro 3800), using Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl paper. All prints are corner mounted to acid-free boards and over-matted with acid-free mats, and hand signed by photographer David Best.

 Larger Image

This National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass is your ticket to more than 2,000 federal recreation sites. A pass covers entrance and standard amenity fees for a driver and all passengers in a personal vehicle at per vehicle fee areas (or up to four adults at sites that charge per person). Good for 1 year.

Plus: Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!
$1,000 - LEGEND PACKAGE
1) Hetch Hetchy Panorama Print - 13 x 30 paper mounted to 18 x 40
Image created digitally and printed on Epson archival inkjet printers (Epson Stylus Pro 3800), using Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl paper. All prints are corner mounted to acid-free boards and over-matted with acid-free mats, and hand signed by photographer David Best.

 Larger Image
2) The Wapama Stroll
Meet up with Allison & Tom as they finish Muir's March August 3, 2013 at O’Shaughnessy Dam! This is a 1-day hike, six-mile out-and-back, from O’Shaughnessy Dam to Wapama Falls. Hikers who prefer a shorter route can turn back at any point.
The Wapama Stroll is perfect for families and friends of all ages. This hike includes two nights of camping, a specially prepared gourmet barbecue on Friday night and the Restoration Festival on August 3. The 6-mile round-trip self-paced hike follows the northern rim of Hetch Hetchy Valley and shows firsthand the impact of the reservoir.Please message us for more details, if needed.
Plus: National Parks Pass, Digital Book, Thank You Postcard, Sticker and Virtual Fist Bump!
No Perk Option - Tax DeductibleOr, if you prefer to make a tax deductible donation with no perks, please visit our Muir's March Donation Page.
For Our International Supporters: please add $10 to your pledge to account for shipping costs. Also, for the $1,000 Legendary Package perk of The Wapama Stroll, you will be responsible for transportation to and from Hetch Hetchy in Yosemite National Park. 
 
How You Can Help!
Buy a Perk! After that....
1. Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media and ask your friends to help!
2. Connect with Restore Hetch Hetchy on social media
         
3. Watch and talk about the Dam Nation Film when in comes out in Winter, 2013.
 
More Info: The Work to Restore Hetch Hetchy Valley
The Hetch Hetchy Valley was described by John Muir as “one of nature’s rarest and most precious mountain temples.” The pristine Tuolumne River flowed along the valley floor, surrounded by flowered meadows and ancient forests which teemed with bears and bobcats, rushes and eagles. Hetch Hetchy Valley was considered one of the most unique and diverse ecosystems in the world.

Initially protected by the establishment of Yosemite National Park, in 1913 the city of San Francisco won congressional approval to build the O’Shaughnessy Dam which buried this extraordinary wilderness valley under 300 feet of water. Although John Muir was unsuccessful in preventing this from happening, his rigorous campaign resulted in the creation of an international environmental conservation movement.
Modern engineering advances afford us the opportunity to remove the reservoir and create one of the most ambitious and exciting environmental restoration projects in human history. As a living laboratory, Hetch Hetchy will advance the science of restoration by providing biologists, ecologists and botanists from all over the world with the chance to apply cutting-edge science to re-establishing lost habitats.
Soon after the valley is drained and the valley floor becomes exposed, Hetch Hetchy could also serve as a classroom for teachers, students and volunteers to experience restoration first hand, with tours for the public to learn about the restoration efforts and the area’s wildlife.
Within five years, native grasses and wildlife would begin to reappear as the Tuolumne River reclaimed its original channel. Willows and alders would quickly return to its banks and, soon after, Ponderosa pines and oak woodlands would begin to take root. As habitat restored itself, large numbers of animals would migrate home and the twin of Yosemite Valley would re-emerge in the light of the 21st century.
Families from around the world will be able to return to Hetch Hetchy Valley year after year to witness a national treasure coming back to life.
A restored Hetch Hetchy Valley will result in:

The re-creation of 9 miles of the “wild and scenic” Tuolumne River
The regeneration of 3 square miles of extraordinary wilderness
The restoration of habitat for thousands of animal and plant species
The creation of miles of hiking trails and numerous camp sites
The establishment of an international classroom for restoration scientists
Information from www.hetchhetchy.org
 
"Energy and persistence conquer all things."
- Benjamin Franklin

story:
Wetlands Matter.

Did you know that 75% of Wisconsin’s wetlands are in private ownership?

Wisconsin Wetlands Association wants to help private wetland landowners around Wisconsin be the best wetland stewards they can be.

We all receive the benefits of wetlands, but the ability of wetlands to do their job depends on private landowners.  Some of these people don't even know they have wetlands on their property, and many have no idea how to care for them.

You can help us improve wetland stewardship by contributing to this campaign!  

John & Kathy's Story.

John and Kathy contacted Wisconsin Wetlands Association with questions about a large wetland on their land. They wanted to restore and protect their wetland, but weren’t sure how. John’s initial thought was to deepen the wetland with a bulldozer to create a duck habitat.

With help from Wisconsin Wetlands Association, John and Kathy learned that their wetland contained desirable native vegetation and wildlife habitat and that deepening the wetland, though well-intentioned, may cause more harm than good. They also learned that the water feeding their wetland was shared with adjacent lands.

Today, John and Kathy are working with their neighbors to protect a wetland complex, since it does not stop at property lines. They are also spreading the word about the benefits of healthy wetlands in their community.

How is Wisconsin Wetlands Association helping?

Wisconsin Wetlands Association has produced a new publication, My Healthy Wetlands, an easy to read publication designed to provide landowners with basic information about what wetlands are, why they matter, and how to care for them -- and to inspire them to act.

Your support for this campaign will put this new publication into the hands of private wetland landowners.  Your contribution will make sure wetland landowners get the information and tools they need to protect and care for their wetlands.

As the nation's first and oldest statewide organization focused exclusively on wetland protection, Wisconsin Wetlands Association is uniquely positioned to reach private wetland landowners with this information and support. Our award winning programs help people around Wisconsin understand what wetlands are and why they matter.  

Why should we protect and care for wetlands?

Wetlands provide many important natural benefits that improve our human communities and add to our quality of life:

  1. Wetlands protect our communities from flooding
  2. Wetlands clean and filter water for drinking, swimming, boating and fishing
  3. Wetlands help recharge our groundwater
  4. Wetlands protect our shorelines
  5. Wetlands provide important habitat for fish and wildlife
  6. Wetlands provide places for education and recreation (outdoor recreation is a leading driver of Wisconsin’s vital tourism economy).

How can YOU help?

Your support for My Healthy Wetlands will reach people like John and Kathy with the information they need.  Your support could make the difference for people like John and Kathy who want to do the right thing but need effective tools and support.

What We Need & What You Get

We have raised more than 75% of the funds needed to complete this project. We need your help to raise the remainder.  And right now, your gift will be matched, dollar-for-dollar.  Double your impact by giving today!

  • We need to raise at least $5,000 in order to reach 5,000 landowners with the My Healthy Wetlands handbook.
  • For every $5 you give, we will provide one wetland landowner with a copy of the My Healthy Wetlands  handbook.  
  • Every dollar raised will be used to print and distribute the My Healthy Wetlands handbook to a private wetland landowner. 

The Impact

No matter who you are or where you live, wetlands benefit your life.  

Your support for this project will mean better, healthier wetlands.  And that benefits all of us.  More and healthier wetlands means cleaner water, better wildlife habitat, and reduced flood impacts.

Our strategy is tested and proven.  The My Healthy Wetlands handbook is modeled after the award-winning My Healthy Woods handbook that was produced by our partners the Aldo Leopold Foundation, which is already making a difference to the way private landowners are caring for woodlands in Wisconsin.  To build upon this success, Wisconsin Wetlands Association has partnered with the Aldo Leopold Foundation to develop My Healthy Wetlands. This first edition of My Healthy Wetlands will be targeted for wetland landowners in Northeast Wisconsin; future editions will target other parts of Wisconsin.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help us make better and healthier wetlands:

  • Spread the word!  Tell your friends, family, and colleagues about our campaign to help private wetland landowners, and encourage them to help out.  
  • Use our campaign's convenient share tools to spread the word through your social networks!

Help us help private wetland landowners around Wisconsin be the best wetland stewards they can be.  Better, healthier wetlands help us all.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Fungai Chiposi. I am passionate about community development and uplifting standards of living of all Zimbabweans.

In 2012, after being repulsed by the litter around my residence in the Avenues, Harare; I gathered a group of friends and started crafting an anti-litter campaign. The campaign called BIN-it Zimbabwe became active in 2013 and added 318 bins into Harare CBD.

I am convinced that Zimbabwe can attain Zero Litter and the 1,000km YOUTH Walkathon is my way of getting support for this vision from those passionate about the environment.

The walk will begin in Plumtree, proceed to Bulawayo, Gweru, Masvingo, Birchenough Bridge, Mutare and finally Harare. I will raise awareness on litter disposal in every city.

Your contribution will give me the strength required to complete this challenge. It will further enable us to have resurces such as food and shelter required by the team that is supporting me in this quest. I will channel any excess funding to BIN-it Zimbabwe campaign which requires USD500,000.00 in 2014 for litter eradication strategies to be implemented.

What We Need & What You Get

Hereunder is a specific summary of what we need:

  • We require USD10,000.00 to complete the walkathon according to our meagre budget.
  • Through this walkathon, I hope to raise USD500,000.00 for BIN-it Zimbabwe program which has greatly impacted Zimbabwe in terms of waste management.

Your contribution towards this event will be immortalised in our records. We will further send you a digital certificate for your participation. Prime Contributors to this campaign will receive a special certificate that will be revealed in on April 12 2014.

  • We have structured three different levels for everyone to be able to support. Most prominent in them all is recognition of your contribution.

The Impact

This is not just a YOUTH Walkathon. For a start, the route will definitely cover 1,000km making it a first in Zimbabwe. I will do the following during this Walkathon;

  • Will stop in every capital city and get the Mayor and/or Town Clerk to sign a pledge to collect litter regularly and support/initiate recycling initiatives.
  • Will carry GREEN Mile Perk certificates that will be signed in every city and will be mailed to all GREEN Mile Perk contributors. This certificate will establish YOU as a true GREEN friend of Zimbabwe. The certificate holders will forever be listed on our website and will receive acknowledgement by all in Zimbabwe.

Your contribution, no matter how small, will prod Zimbabwe towards excellent environmental practises and impact communites across the country.

Proudly Zimbabwean Foundation Trust is a fully registered trust in Zimbabwe. Its Board of Trustees is led by Dr. Joseph Kanyekanye and comprises of Mr. Godfrey Pasipanodya, Mrs. Divine Simbi-Ndhlukula, Mr. Dave Emberton and Mr. Fungai Chiposi (Executive Trustee).

All funds raised from this campaign will be deposited into Proudly Zimbabwean Foundation account which is closely monitored and co-signed by the Trustees.

We are committed to community develoment in Zimbabwe.

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the main reasons I am embarking on this quest is to spread awareness of how litter is damaging Zimbabwe. For me to do this, I need your help. Alone, I am only one voice in the wilderness but with you, I am a sea of change. I am passionate about develpment and progress.

In Africa there is a word called UBUNTU; We are therefore I am.

Whether you have contributed to this campaign or not, please tell your friends. Post this campaign to all social spaces and encourage your friends and family to support.

Please use Indiegogo share tools that will allow you to post this campaign to your wall.

THANK YOU FOR TAKING TIME TO READ THIS APPEAL.

story:
The Honeybees are not doing well. This year alone there has been an average loss of 60% of the honey bee colonies in the U.S. alone. That is a devastating amount to lose so quickly. It is a truly staggering number when you think of it as 1.5 MILLION domestic honeybee colonies Have Died this year. Without bees, we will lose so much of our agriculture that is dependent on them for pollination that it would change the face of the earth! There is hope! With your help, we can save the bees one hive at a time! $1 Will Make A Difference!  Donate Now!

     We are G&W Honey Farms. Our company's goal: to save the bees, one hive at a time. We are working with Shelby Farms, Grow Memphis, the Memphis Zoo, the Memphis Botanic Garden and many others. To do this, we need your help. We are working to expand the number of beehives we have to help us breed a honey bee better suited to surviving in the modern world.

     We are raising money to be able to purchase 200 more honeybee colonies, a truck, extracting equipment, hive equipment, educational materials, and a honey house. With these, we will be able expand our education co-operative with Shelby Farms 100 colony project and Grow Memphis. Meeting our fundraising goal will bring us to 400 hives that we manage and allow us to work full time helping the honeybee and managing colonies. It is our goal to one day have a large honey house with observation hives, windows to view honey extraction, presentation area, and a garden area containing examples of local honey plants. Please, help save the honeybee, donate today!

     Willie comes from a family of beekeepers and got his first honeybee hive at 4 years old! He has always had an interest in how bees adapt to their environment. In his research, he learned that honeybees in New Zealand were forced to adapt to pests because of a ban on beekeeper there using a pesticides in the control of mites in their hives. Since learning this he has not used pesticides in his hives since. He continues to practice selective breeding to develop a line of honeybees suited to surviving whatever may be thrown their way.

    George started keeping bees 5 years ago after working with Willie on taking care of his hives. He has a strong desire to save the honeybee and has adopted practices to save them. He actively seeks to save every swarm he is called for no matter how hard they are to reach. He is also a strong supporter of better education about the bees, and fights tirelessly to prevent the destruction of the honeybee!

     Willie and George started keeping bees together 5 years ago with the common dream to help develop beekeeping practices and to help bees survive the new problems plaguing them in this modern world. We have worked towards these goals by breeding bees for survival traits and staying away from practices we think are harmful to the long term survival of the honey bee.

    Together, they formed, G&W Honey Farms, a company dedicated to improve bee health, educating the public, and helping to develop new practices to save the honeybee. Together with Shelby Farms, Grow Memphis, the Memphis Zoo, and the Memphis Botanic Garden we are working toward raising awareness for the honeybee's plight, and help to teach a younger generation the joys and wonder that come with keeping bees. If you visit the zoo, stop by and see the observation hive. You may find one of us there checking on the status of the bees we keep there!

    Now is the time you can help too, help them to save the honeybee! Donate today!

A breakdown of the equipment we need:

  • A truck for transporting bees and equipment
  • A large honey extractor
  • Uncapping tank and wax melter
  • 200 Tradition Langstroth hives and honey supers
  • 4 Top bar hives
  • Honey house for storing equipment,extracting honey, teaching, and queen rearing
  • Observation hives for teaching
  • Bee suits and hive tools for classes
  • Education materials

Update:Willie, and possibly George too, will be teaching a class with Grow Memphis on the 24th at Overton Square clock tower. please join us there at 6:30 to learn some basics about keeping bees, for good company, and to have any questions answered about bees.

Update:We will be at the Memphis Zoo Harvest Festival September 26th and 27th from 9am-4pm. Come out and meet us!
story_txt:
The Honeybees are not doing well. This year alone there
has been an average loss of 60% of the
honey bee colonies in the U.S. alone. That is a devastating amount to lose so
quickly. It is a truly staggering number when you think of it as 1.5 MILLION domestic honeybee colonies Have Died this year. Without bees, we will lose
so much of our agriculture that is dependent on them for pollination that it
would change the face of the earth! There is hope! With your help, we can save
the bees one hive at a time!  $1 Will Make A Difference!  Donate Now!
     We
are G&W Honey Farms. Our company's goal: to save the bees, one hive at a
time. We are working with Shelby Farms, Grow Memphis, the Memphis Zoo, the
Memphis Botanic Garden and many others. To do this, we need your help. We are working to expand
the number of beehives we have to help us breed a honey bee better suited to surviving in
the modern world.
     We are raising money to be able to purchase 200 more honeybee colonies, a truck, extracting equipment, hive equipment, educational materials, and a honey house. With these, we will be able expand our education
co-operative with Shelby Farms 100 colony project and Grow Memphis. Meeting our fundraising goal will bring us to 400 hives that we manage and allow us to work full time helping the honeybee and managing colonies. It is our goal to one day have
a large honey house with observation hives, windows to view honey extraction,
presentation area, and a garden area containing examples of local honey plants.
Please, help save the honeybee, donate today!
   
 Willie comes from a family of beekeepers and got his first honeybee hive
at 4 years old! He has always had an interest in how bees adapt to their
environment. In his research, he learned that honeybees in New Zealand were
forced to adapt to pests because of a ban on beekeeper there using a pesticides
in the control of mites in their hives. Since learning this he has not
used pesticides in his hives since. He continues to practice selective breeding
to develop a line of honeybees suited to surviving whatever may be thrown their
way.
    George
started keeping bees 5 years ago after working with Willie on taking care of
his hives. He has a strong desire to save the honeybee and has adopted
practices to save them. He actively seeks to save every swarm he is called for
no matter how hard they are to reach. He is also a strong supporter of better
education about the bees, and fights tirelessly to prevent the destruction of
the honeybee!     Willie and George started keeping bees together 5 years ago with the common dream to help develop beekeeping practices and to help bees survive the new problems plaguing them in this modern world. We have worked towards these goals by breeding bees for survival traits and staying away from practices we think are harmful to the long term survival of the honey bee.
   
Together, they formed, G&W Honey Farms, a company dedicated to improve bee
health, educating the public, and helping to develop new practices to save the
honeybee. Together with Shelby Farms, Grow Memphis, the Memphis Zoo, and the Memphis
Botanic Garden we are working toward raising awareness for the honeybee's
plight, and help to teach a younger generation the joys and wonder that come
with keeping bees. If you visit the zoo, stop by and see the observation hive.
You may find one of us there checking on the status of the bees we keep there!
    Now is
the time you can help too, help them to save the honeybee! Donate today!A breakdown of the equipment we need:
A truck for transporting bees and equipment
A large honey extractor
Uncapping tank and wax melter
200 Tradition Langstroth hives and honey supers
4 Top bar hives
Honey house for storing equipment,extracting honey, teaching, and queen rearing
Observation hives for teaching
Bee suits and hive tools for classes
Education materials

Update:Willie, and possibly
George too, will be teaching a class with Grow Memphis on the 24th at Overton
Square clock tower. please join us there at 6:30 to learn some basics about
keeping bees, for good company, and to have any questions answered about bees.
Update:We will be at the
Memphis Zoo Harvest Festival September 26th and 27th from 9am-4pm. Come out and
meet us!

story:
.Ozone Drive, the Silent Revolution of Electric Cars

Institutional recognition from:

          

Conceived at the University of California at Berkeley, .Ozone Drive brings to life the ideal of sustainable mobility, where the pollutant emissions, noise level, and ecological footprint fall radically down to zero. We are transforming mobility by facilitating access to electric vehicles. 

[ Each $5000 received will translate into a new full electric vehicle incorporated to our fleet for 1 year ]



FEATURED REWARDS

 Plant and Name your Tree

 Test-drive a Full Electric Car !

 Attend Formula E Race, London


OUR BUSINESS MODEL

.Ozone Drive currently promotes EVs along the Mediterranean islands, starting with Spain. We target customers who are willing to have a daily positive impact in the world, and provide them a risk-free opportunity to experience electric cars, through a clean, emotional and attractive brand, strongly attached to their values, lifestyle, environmental awareness and aspirations. 
By partnering with major hotel chains and car manufacturers, we facilitate access to electric charging, thus assuring a perfect rental experience and a complete solution for electromobility for the first time in the industry.

We invite you to have a better taste on our services watching real .Ozone Drive user experiences at our website. They are incredibly fun !


WHERE ARE WE TODAY?

We have already launched our services in the Balearic Islands in 2014 and have created an important impact, not only in terms of electric car driving experiences, but also in terms of media atenttion to EVs, featuring .Ozone Drive in some of the most prestigious media channels in Europe.


WHERE ARE WE GOING NEXT?

We will focus first on expanding our services across some of the most attractive and impactful locations in the Mediterranean islands. However, we will also consider transatlantic opportunities of development as they arise. The Caribbean, Florida, California, or Hawaii represent some of the locations where we would love to operate in the future.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT ?

.Ozone Drive expansion strategy is currently limited upon its partnerships with hotels and car manufacturers for the distribution of its electric rental services. In order to expand organically, .Ozone Drive needs the financial capacity to manage its own fleet of 100% electric vehicles.

After market validation and the overwhelming customer acceptance of the .Ozone Drive Electric Road Show in 2014 (http://electricroadshow.ozonedrive.com/), we need your support to launch a PERMANENT rental fleet in the Balearic Islands (Mallorca, Menorca, Ibiza). This will enable us to deploy more EV services along the Mediterranean and achieve sustainable growth.

Your donations will help us afford the leasing costs of our electric fleet: ($5,000 leasing cost/car/year). Therefore:

  • Each $5000 received will translate into a new full electric vehicle incorporated to our fleet for 1 year.



AWARDS & RECOGNITIONS

.Ozone Drive has received financial and institutional awards and recognition from European Institutions, affirming its business model strength and its environmental impact.

“Ozone Drive places itself at the forefront of a new kind of touristic services while minimizing the environmental impact.” – European Commissioner of Energy and Climate Change.

  • Spanish Ministry of Environment (institutional and financing support)

  • Spanish Ministry of Industry, Energy and Tourism (institutional and financing support)

  • Biodiversity Foundation and European Union (institutional recognition)

  • Spain Startup Investor Summit (Top 5 most promising cleantech startups in Europe, Award)

  • FITUR 2014, Top 3 international tourism fairs in the world (Invited .Ozone Drive to present its innovative business approach)

  • Ozone Drive Electric Road Show has been featured in national and international press and media.


PERKS FOR DONORS 

In addition to helping EV adoption through your donation, you will also get the chance to receive our fantastic perks.


OUR TEAM: bridging Silicon Valley and Spain through sustainable transport

ANGEL SAMARTINO, Founder & CEO

Master in Business Administration (MBA) from University of California at Berkeley, with a focus on Management of Technology and Entrepreneurship. Double degree in Industrial Engineering from ICAI Madrid and Ecole Centrale Paris Universities, Top Industrial Managers for Europe Program.

From 2005 to 2008 Angel worked at the Engineering Department at Renault in Spain. In 2009 he joined the Global Infrastructure Deployment at Better Place in Palo Alto, Silicon Valley, California, where he was directly involved in the development of electric vehicle charging infrastructure in Israel, Denmark and Australia. During this time, Angel gained first-hand expertise on new technology and innovative business models applied to electric vehicles.

In May 2010, at UC Berkeley, the idea for OzoneDrive was born and developed, and in January 2011, the company was incorporated. Since then, Angel has grown the idea into a full-fledged company in Spain and launched its main services in 2014, achieving large press success and customer satisfaction.

PABLO DIAZ, Director of Operations.

Starting in the UK at Hertz, Pablo has worked for more than 15 years in the rent-a-car industry, gaining profound experience in all the operational aspects of the business from planning to kickoff. Appointed Fleet Manager at EasyCar in the UK, he was responsible for all fleet operations in Netherlands, France and Spain. He was then invited to form part of the initial launching team as Fleet Director at PepeCar  in Spain. Both companies are still considered a complete success in introducing the then new paradigm of low-cost rentals based on operative excellence, yield pricing techniques and high fleet utilization.  

Pablo has the unparalleled  knowhow and required experience to launch and operate new mobility companies. In addition, his extensive network in the industry brings unique and precious value to .Ozone Drive.

EDUARDO AVENDAÑO, Corporate Communications Manager

Eduardo is an expert in sustainable mobility, energy and environmental policies in the European Union, providing relevant strategic input for .Ozone Drive communication strategy. He has been behind the whole corporate communication strategy of the brand within the industry, as well as leading high-level conversations with other industrial players.

CARLOS LOPEZ, Advisor

Carlos holds an Industrial Engineering Degree from ICAI University in Spain and a Master in Engines from the ENSPM in Paris. He has more than 15 years of experience in the automotive industry working for many of the most important car manufacturers in the world: Nissan; Renault; Peugeot and Citroën, where he has also acted as Electric Vehicle Technical Manager for Spain.

He advices the team in electric powertrain and charging infrastructure technologies.



FAQ’s

1. Do you own your own fleet of vehicles?

No, we get our vehicles “on lease” from the car manufacturers with which we partner. However we plan on owning our own fleet in the future, when we obtain additional funding.

2. Which car manufacturers do you partner with currently?

We currently use BMW i3 vehicles in our fleet, however are not exclusively tied to them.

3. How do you monetize at the moment?

Currently, we serve as a promotional agency for electric car manufacturers, through organizing ad-hoc electromobility events for them. We promote EVs for manufacturers and facilitate EV access to citizens.

4. How do you plan on monetizing in the future?

We expect to expand into a fully owned and operated fleet of EVs that we disperse across various locations in Europe, offering 100% electric rental services.

5. Do you have a network of charging stations?

Our network of charging stations is intimately connected to hotel locations. As we expand and build out our own fleet of vehicles, we will invest in a robust network of charging stations, as well.

6. How do you guarantee that I will receive my reward?

Once the campaign is finished, we will focus on delivering all the committed rewards, so that you can enjoy your perk as soon as possible. In case we find any problems in delivering a specific reward (due to geographic constraints, stockouts, etc.), we will contact you to determine the best alternative. In case we cannot provide you with any similar or acceptable reward, we will refund your contribution back.

7. If the project does not reach its funding goal, do I get my money back?

No, because we are doing a Flexible Campaign, which means that even if we don’t reach our goal, we will still receive all the funds raised.  This means that your contributions to our cause will still be going towards expanding our business to achieve full adoption of EVs in Europe and America.


Learn More about .Ozone Drive

www.ozonedrive.com [commercial site]
www.ozonedrive.net   [corporate site]
www.vimeo.com/ozonedrive [videos]
http://electricroadshow.ozonedrive.com/#od-drivs [drivers' experiences]

story:
My name is Robyn Hamlyn. I am 16 years old and I am trying to save our water.

Since I was 12, my mom has been driving me all across Ontario so that I can present to City/Town council meetings in order for me to get resolutions passed that will protect our water. She has also been driving me to speaking engagements where I try to get the word out to kids and adults about our world's water crisis.

If you want to read more about me and my story, I have created a website called

www.thewaterwarriors.ca to help spread the word about our water crisis and how people can help.

I have just recently been invited to be a delegate speaker at the International Youth Ngo's Summit in India from July 24th to July 26th, 2015 (www.iyons.com)!

This is a huge event to connect young leaders, from over 120 countries, to address top global issues, such as peace, hunger, women empowerment, child education, human rights, the environment, etc. It is being planned on the lines of a United Nations Conference and I am very excited about it :)

I have told everyone that I have met that I am on a journey to protect and preserve our water. My goal is to reach as many people as I can and let them know how they can help conserve and protect our fresh water.

This event will help me do just that. This is a chance for me to make a real difference, to help save our water not just in Canada but across the world! It's going to help me to inspire kids across the world to make a change and to speak to representatives from 120+ countries! This is an opportunity I can't pass up, but I can't do it without your help.

IYONS will cover my accommodations and food but I have to raise funds to cover the cost of me and my mom's flight as well my mom's food and accommodation costs.

If you visit my Facebook page The Water Warriors, you will see the IYONS' letter of invitation to me as well as their letter that I can present to those who are interested in sponsoring my trip.

Please help me reach my goal.

story:
We have a winner!

We are very pleased to announce that Dr. Bret Freudenthal is the winner of the 1st EMGS Young Scientist Award!

Thank you all very much for your participation and support of our amazing young scientists - we congratulate them all on their accomplishments and inspiring and entertaining videos.

Because we met our goal, we can keep our campaign open as "In Demand", which means you can still help us reach our secondary goal of providing travel awards to our runners-up and other young scientists. Remember, we have donors who will match up to $750 new donations. 

Environmental Mutagenesis and Genomics Society

Ever wonder what things in the environment do to your genes? We are the Environmental Mutagenesis and Genomics Society (EMGS), scientists in academia, government, and industry working to understand the genetic impacts of environmental exposures to promote human health. Through research we learn how genes in your body respond to the environment, how changes impact health and get passed to your children, and what we should do about this.

EMGS Young Scientist Award

Scientists are people. EMGS is committed to helping young scientists - our future - make critical career transitions. At our Annual Meeting, we feature the EMGS Young Scientist Award, a chance for a new investigator embarking on an independent scientific career to give a plenary talk. Don't underestimate this honor! Face-to-face communication is one of the most important ways we learn, network, and make our science better.

You pick the winner

The EMGS Young Scientist Award is based on YOUR support and YOU will choose the winner from the candidates below! Please view their competition videos via the Gallery link, above. This is a unique opportunity to participate in science and support a promising young scientist.

Nikolai Chepelev

Nikolai Chepelev has recently completed post-doctoral training under the leadership of Dr. Carole Yauk at the Genomics Laboratory, Healthy Environments and Consumer Safety Branch, Health Canada. For his research in toxicogenomics, he has received two awards from the Risk Assessment Specialty Section of the Society of Toxicology, including an award for the Best Published Paper Advancing the Science of Risk Assessment. Nikolai is a post-doctoral fellow with Integrated Laboratory Systems, where he is currently applying toxicogenomics in the re-assessment of the adverse effects of acrylamide. His long-term goal is to develop a research program that leverages toxicogenomics and other powerful high-throughput technologies to improve toxicity testing, and continue the momentum towards improved 21st century approaches in toxicology.

Publications in PubMed

Bret Freudenthal

Dr. Freudenthal recently completed his postdoctoral work with Dr. Samuel Wilson at the National Institutes of Environmental Health and has transitioned to an independent Assistant Professor position at the University of Kansas Medical Center. The overarching goal of his research is to understand how environmental hazards that damage the DNA lead to deleterious human health outcomes. He utilizes a reductionist approach consisting of structural, biochemical, and molecular biology assays to investigate complex biological questions. By combining this multi-disciplinary approach with cellular collaborations he hopes to make better therapeutic treatments for human diseases.

Publications in PubMed

The rules

Contestants are screened by EMGS and invited to participate. All are just finishing their education and training or within 3 years of establishing an independent scientific career.

Anyone making a tax-deductible donation of any amount gets a vote (you may donate/vote as many times as you'd like). The candidate with the most votes wins.

Up to $2,500 will go toward hosting the award winner's attendance at the meeting and a small honorarium. Additional contributions will support the travel of more young scientists to Kansas City.

The 47th Annual Meeting of the EMGS

Enabling technologies have driven our knowledge of the structure and content of the human genome and epigenome to dizzying heights and are empowering large scale toxicological assessments. Our challenge is rapidly changing from simply obtaining genomic, epigenomic, and toxicological data to interpreting and using that data to improve human health. We will examine how exposures and the environment continue to shape the genome of individuals and populations. We will further learn how measuring or imputing the response of the genome and epigenome to environmental agents is providing powerful new approaches for understanding the genetic impacts of human exposures.

EMGS 2016 focus topics:

  • Mechanisms of DNA damage and repair, somatic and germline mutagenesis, and their genomic signatures in health and disease.
  • Ways in which the environment modifies the epigenome and thus gene expression.
  • Next-generation methods in applied genetic toxicology; how technology and innovation are changing our approach to risk assessment.
