We bought the truck and built the Praying Mantis on our savings. As you can tell from the video, we don't spend our money perfecting things, we get stuff done efficiently and we do it ourselves to be frugal. But the start-up costs have been high and we need a second truck before we go into next spring because we expect to haul twice the amount we are now, or we will be in the vulnerable position of having many clients serviced by an old, ailing truck. We're not looking for the $100,000 truck every garbage company uses; a $10,000 truck will suffice. If we don't hit our goal, the money will still go towards a second truck. Composting is important. We're making a difference. We'd really appreciate your help in making a bigger difference! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please tell anyone and everyone. Link us to facebook and everything else! It really helps us out.

story:
ALL FUNDS RAISED WILL BE USED TO COVER START-UP OPERATIONAL COSTS.

  • Eogea Inc. is a nonprofit organization that provides funding to small businesses and individuals developing new green technology and emerging sustainable industries. 

  • Eogea supports these green causes through grants provided from a proprietary endowment fund called the World Sustainability Fund (WSF). 
  • Eogea gives back to its donors by generating extensive publicity for them as green advocates and by offering them exclusive connections through the Eogea network. 

    Read below for more details about what we do!

Our Story and Why Eogea was Founded.

We are consuming and depleting the world’s non-renewable resources; the problem is obvious. Without developing new technology to sustain the world’s limited resources, our future generations will never enjoy the lifestyle in which we currently live.

Eogea’s core mission is to sustain our Earth’s precious, non-renewable resources and to encourage people worldwide to be more environmentally aware and active.

To do this, we have created an endowment fund called The Worldwide Sustainability Fund (WSF). The WSF will provide financial backing to small businesses with the intention to research and develop innovative green applications or implement sustainable practices. The WSF awards penalty-free grant funding to applicants with promising projects aimed to develop technologies or practices to sustain the world’s limited resources.

Funding for the WSF will be provided by people and businesses worldwide. By way of saying ‘thanks’ for the donation given, Eogea will publicly advertise the donor's support of creating a brighter, more eco-friendly future. Contributors will also gain access to a growing community of individuals and businesses that all say “I stand for a greener planet.” Donors will be able to promote eco-friendly practices while simultaneously connecting themselves to other green-conscious people and businesses.

A healthy attitude and healthy world go hand in hand, and we hope that you’ll be involved in giving us the jump start Eogea needs. With Eogea, you will personally be part of the solution to help sustain the planet’s natural resources.

But we don’t want to just stop there. We will be educating the public of ways to become more sustainable in their daily lives. This information will range from simple tips to large scale projects.

In addition to these educational projects, Eogea will eventually provide a platform for innovative people to develop creative solutions for some of the world’s most ecologically pressing questions.  

We Believe...

Sustainability gives back. Green technology and sustainable practices preserve healthy ecosystems and environments, which provide vital resources such as clean water and clean air.  

You are investing in the Earth. You will be funding the companies that seek to improve the world for the benefit of us all.


Great ideas must be pursued. Everyone has great ideas, and some of these ideas could change the world. We cannot let an idea go to waste and become forgotten because the innovators did not have the funds to pursue it. 

 

The Impact

Over the next 50 years the world’s most crucial resources will experience a catastrophic depletion. Based on current projections the world population will increase from 6.5 billion people to 9 billion people within this 50 year period. This increase in population will drive an increase in demand for our already limited resources.

Many current non-profit organizations aim to alleviate issues relating to the availability of food and water, education and victim relief. These are commendable humanitarian efforts, but it’s a battle that doesn’t get at the root of the problem. With the increase in population and decrease in resources these problems are going to skyrocket. Without new sustainability technology it will be impossible to provide aid to these areas of need.

The only way to avoid this catastrophe is to develop green technologies to solve these problems before they get out of hand. This is your chance to be part of a solution, by supporting Eogea! There are so many reasons to donate. Here are just a few:

  1. We promote public awareness about environmental concerns and the need to create a more sustainable planet.
  2. We provide financial backing for small businesses looking to implement sustainable ideas.
  3. Support of small businesses creates satisfying jobs that to help bolster the economy.
  4. We will educate the public, from simple to complex methods, to become more eco-friendly.
  5. We provide an online community designed to assist the public in becoming more ecologically friendly.
  6. We offer a platform for creative people to get together and discuss ecological problems
  7. Together we will help create a more sustainable world for future generations

 

What We Need & What You Get

Starting a business of this magnitude is no easy thing. The money raised will be used for filing fees, legal fees, and operating costs to continue developing this idea and get this company off the ground and flying. All of Eogea’s volunteers are passionate, enthusiastic and, most importantly, determined to deliver upon Eogea’s mission. Here's a quick breakdown of how these funds will be used.

Legal Fees = 18%
Business Materials = 3%
Marketing= 10%
Financial Fees = 37%
Web Hosting = 10%
Contest Winners = 22%

Eogea gives back in several ways. Our advocates become members of an online community designed to show the public that they as donors support the development of sustainable methods and technology. We also give our members the chance to network with our other supporting organizations and the other members of Eogea’s community.

We give you a few perks too!

Other Ways You CAN Help. 

  • If you are unable to contribute financially, no worries, you can still help! Share this campaign and get the word out and tell your friends, families, and co-workers. You can click here to tweet about our campaign and Here to share it on facebook.
  • If you have campaigning ideas or questions, contact us! fundraisers@eogea.com
  • Go to Eogea.com and sign up to receive an e-mail when we launch the website.
  • Generate some buzz! Let the world hear your voice, leave a comment on this page after you donate and stand up for sustainable ideas.

Marketing= 10%
Financial Fees = 37%

Eogea gives back in several ways. Our advocates become members of an online community designed to show the public that they as donors support the development of sustainable methods and technology. Other Ways You CAN Help. 



If you are unable to contribute financially, no worries, you can still help! Share this campaign and get the word out and tell your friends, families, and co-workers. You can click here to tweet about our campaign and Here to share it on facebook.


If you have campaigning ideas or questions, contact us! fundraisers@eogea.com


Go to Eogea.com and sign up to receive an e-mail when we launch the website.


Generate some buzz! Let the world hear your voice, leave a comment on this page after you donate and stand up for sustainable ideas.

story:
Kaj Ouellet et Louis-Philippe Cyr sont deux étudiants du Baccalauréat en études de l'environnement de l'Université de Sherbrooke.

Très impliqués dans leur communauté, ces deux aventuriers tenteront de transmettre leur expertise et leur passion pour l'alimentation durable lors d'un voyage humanitaire à vocation environnementale et sociale.

Durant leur séjour de 4 mois en Tanzanie, dans un petit village à proximité de Moshi, ils devront réussir à mettre sur pied un système équilibré de décomposition de la matière organique (composte), qui servira à augmenter le rendement agricole des communautés voisines.

Ils auront à collaborer avec les jeunes du village afin d'assurer le succès et la pérennité du projet. À l'aide de ces jeunes, un protocole de maintien de la qualité du composte sera élaboré en anglais ainsi qu'en swahili, permettant la compréhension pour tous.

Ce voyage humanitaire est entièrement financé par ces deux étudiants. Ils ont donc besoin de votre aide afin de rendre ce projet une réalité!

" La saveur d'un pain partagé n'a pas d'égal "

- Saint-Exupéry -

Merci de votre générosité !

story:
While environmental responsibility is becoming a bigger part of our culture, it is often difficult to see how you can make a difference.

The idea of "Going Green" can be overwhelming. Where do you start? Where do you make changes? What does it involve? How much time and effort will this take? What will it cost?

"Going Green" isn't just about championing an environmental cause. It's about improving your own life one day at a time. It starts at home. It starts with you. It starts by learning about healthier alternatives as well as making informed choices for you and your family, not just for the greater good but for your own improved health and well being.

Living a healthy, green life has been a passion of mine for over two decades. My own personal health was compromised several years ago, putting my life and my family's well being at risk. As is often the case, the immediate focus was centered on managing the situation rather than discovering and eliminating the underlying cause.

What really caused it? What could have been done to prevent it? With time and effort, help from some enlightened individuals along with a lot of research, I did recover. But questions still lingered. As environmental factors were at the root of it I began to ask what can I do to keep healthy and avoid a repeat? What could I do to protect my family in the future? How can I help others to do the same?

I started my "Going Green" project because I want to share with all of you, everything I have learned and all the knowledge I continue to collect so that together, we can make improvements to the quality of our lives at home, at work and at play.

By offering private consultations, group workshops and corporate "Lunch & Learn" presentations, I look forward to sharing resources for information and the steps you can easily take to improve your own health and environment, for a better life.

I started this Indiegogo campaign because I would like to promote "Going Green" with a Zero-Emission 100% electric vehicle, as my dream is to move away from my dependence on fossil fuel.  

I have been a stay-at-home mother of two for twelve years now and do not have the funding to purchase an EV (electric vehicle).  I started my small business three years ago and would like to help it grow by promoting it on the EV, so that everywhere I go, people will have the opportunity to see what my business is all about, and that I am indeed "green" with my mode of transportation!

I would like to inspire others to do the same!  Our planet is in crisis and she needs all the help we can give...

I would appreciate anything that you can contribute to help make our world a greener place!  Thank you...

story:
Global warming. Extinction. Sea level rise. Habitat loss. Climate refugees. Pollution. Ocean acidification. Drought.

The problems we are facing seem insurmountable, but we don’t have to face each one individually. By pooling our efforts, knowledge, and skills, society can tackle the key environmental issues of our day. 

Although having women in the board room, labs, and legislative halls provides a diverse perspective that helps society develop creative solutions to the world's problems, women are still drastically underrepresented in positions of leadership, science, and policy.

To help create a global community of women engaged in the discussions effecting our environmental future, the Homeward Bound program selected 42 women in science from around the world, including myself, to participate in a month-long journey to Antarctica to build leadership skills and connect female scientists globally. In January, 2017, the group will learn key leadership strategies, as well as meet with top climate experts on the ground in Antarctica.

I would appreciate any donation you are willing to give to help make my participation in this program successful! My fundraising goal of $1500 helps me pay my 10% deposit to reserve my spot on the expedition.

Ultimately, each trip member is tasked with raising $15,000 to cover just a portion of the expenses of the journey. Much of the $40,000/person cost of the trip, including food, vessel, training, and transportation on the continent, is being financed by outside organizations. 

Your donation helps build a stronger global community of female scientists, and gets us one step closer to solving the major environmental challenges of today!

The expedition is endorsed by the Australian Antarctic Division, with Tasmania Governor Kate Warner a patron. More information on Homeward Bound can be found at: http://homewardboundprojects.com.au/


About Me:

A native Minnesotan, I grew up hiking, fishing, swimming, and exploring in the North Woods. After degrees in Environmental Policy and Conservation Management, I worked in the U.S. House of Representatives writing and advising on energy, conservation, and environmental legislation. More recently, I have worked for Ocean Conservancy, advocating for science-based conservation policy. In my spare time I enjoy reading classic literature and historic biographies, scuba diving, camping, and planning adventures. I also volunteer as a board Vice President for DC EcoWomen, a non-profit organization working to empower women to become leaders in the environmental field.

story:
Project Summary

Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is at the centre of global attention and concern due to evidence of declining health of the reef and its ecosystems. Current plans call for expansion and development of ports and industrial facilities within the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area and surrounding it, adding to the concerns related to impacts from natural causes. At Australian Oceanographics we have prepared a major scientific research program to be at sea year round collecting critical data to help preserve, protect and better manage these outstanding natural habitats. We are proud to be seeking your help to achieve this goal and hope to make it a global mission to better understand and preserve our oceans.

To launch this mission, we recently completed a full refit of two deep-sea manned submersibles in USA, for use in our scientific programs within the Great Barrier Reef and around Australia. Manned research submersibles have never before been based in Australia for dedicated research of the nation's vast ocean environments and their natural assets. Funding for this project will be used to immediately bring the submersibles to Australia and to begin collecting critical baseline data in the areas where marine ecosystems are most likely to be impacted before major developments take place. Our team has assembled the scientific equipment platforms, secured a dedicated research vessel and is ready to begin a series of major research programs aiming to fill information gaps and uncover the unknowns of our oceans. Now all we need is your generous support to fund this major project and help us create a promising future for our oceans.

While our Funding Goal is a significant target that we'd love to achieve and reaching it would allow us to run our C-SEA campaign with ongoing time at sea, we will be able to utilise all contributions whether or not the target is reached.

Who We Are & What We Do

Our company, Australian Oceanographics, strives to develop and provide cutting edge marine and oceanographic research tools and equipment to scientists in Australia. The scientific expertise already exists in Australia, however there is commonly not enough funding for these researchers to acquire or lease the necessary scientific tools to carry out world-class investigations and experiments in Australia's true last frontier, its oceans.

We are addressing this critical gap in scientific capability by providing researchers with free access to the underwater equipment that they cannot afford or acquire. Our primary objective is to bring scientifically capable manned submersibles to Australia to expand oceanographic and marine research capabilities, and to enable scientists to carry out world-class investigations. Along with dedicated manned submersibles we are compiling a range of various innovative and hi-tech equipment to perform groundbreaking studies in Australia’s vast oceans. Scientists are also encouraged to come to us when they identify fundamental research topics but there is no current technology to sufficiently carry out those studies. In this case, we work with the researchers to develop new innovative equipment to help them succeed in their goals. Whatever the needs of the scientists, we pride ourselves in making the technologies freely available to their studies and contributing towards our own research programs.

Our company was established in 2006, founded by two trained scientists that recognized this substantial gap in Australian marine and oceanographic research capabilities. We are based in southeast Queensland, for it's ideal location along the east coast of Australia allowing easy access to the Great Barrier Reef and its associated natural resources, as well as being close to the high density city areas.

We have already secured two DeepWorker 2000 manned submersibles with our crew successfully completing a full refit of both subs to enhance their operational and scientific capability. We have also served as the primary Industry Partner for the “Deep Australia” ARC (Australian Research Council) grant in collaboration with The University of Queensland (UQ), and other leading institutes around the world. The Deep Australia project successfully developed and operated innovative “Research Camera Lander” systems and other innovative equipment. Continuing on from the successes of this grant, we have agreed with UQ to continue working on the Deep Australia project even though government funding for the project has now finished. Collaborations like this with UQ and other institutes will continue and are critical for processing and publishing the data and results that will arise from our efforts in years to come.

Australian Oceanographics now needs your help to kick off a major oceanographic research and monitoring project!

The Project

With Australia’s population growing and our major city centres expanding along the coastlines, marine ecosystems are under a continual pressure to cope with the impacts of development, resource exploitation, recreation and natural catastrophes. Australian Oceanographics has prepared a long-term ecosystem monitoring and investigation program utilizing our innovative scientific platforms and technologies to compile comprehensive baseline data along Australia’s eastern coast.

Under recent review by UNESCO (for more information, visit: http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/154 ) the Australian Government has submitted a report in January 2014 on the current state of the Great Barrier Reef’s conservation and management.  This report describes the current conditions and knowledge gaps of the GBR, demonstrates the management steps already in place and outlines the future objectives and targets for the GBR conservation as the World’s primary custodian of the Reef. A full copy of the report is publicly available (http://www.environment.gov.au/resource/state-party-report-state-conservation-great-barrier-reef-world-heritage-area-australia-2014 ). Australian Oceanographics has actively participated in the many public comment phases related to the preparation of this report and others. Our approach is independent of the Australian Government and associated groups, but our efforts are collaborative and we always strive to support and contribute to the work of Governmental agencies, Universities and other not for profit organizations.

The C-SEA (Continental-Shelf of Eastern Australia) program is the flagship project for Australian Oceanographics and makes up a long-term scientific plan to explore, map and study the marine ecosystems of our ‘backyard’. Examining the coastal and offshore waters of the continental shelf from Cape York, Queensland, to as far south as Sydney, New South Wales, the project aims to provide critical unbiased baseline environmental data to increase our knowledge and understanding of the marine ecosystems found off our coasts, including a focus on the Great Barrier Reef. The  rapidly increasing populations along eastern Australia’s coastline along with our reliance on the oceans for recreation and economic gain are putting immense pressures on these ecosystems that we know little about. We will work in partnership with Australian scientists and international collaborators to focus on current knowledge gaps and collect critical baseline data to better inform management and decision-makers, and to increase awareness for all those who are affected by changes in Australia’s oceans.

The primary research goals of the C-SEA program are to:

  • Collect critical baseline environmental data, which includes documentation of habitat types and ecosystems, organism biodiversity, species identification and abundance, as well as monitoring water quality.
  • Survey the sea floor along eastern Australia’s continental shelf using high-resolution equipment to increase detailed topographic/bathymetric data.
  • Prepare detailed maps to provide a better understanding of what seafloor structures and ecosystems are present in our deep-sea and ocean environments. Seafloor mapping also allows for much more efficient and precise operations of underwater vehicles in relatively unknown or previously uncharted environments.
  • Survey unexplored areas and identify the organisms and ecosystems found within them as well as locate and highlight any historical or culturally significant artefacts.

Performing these fundamental investigations and focusing on areas of natural or scientific significance, proposed industrial and urban developments, high resource potential and regions under threat by natural or human-induced impacts, will enable all of us to better understand the state of our oceans and how to manage their conservation appropriately and sustainably. Our commitment to be at sea year-round performing recurring studies of the same areas and environments at appropriate intervals over time, will allow researchers to broaden their understanding of the natural cycles of environments and how habitats and organisms react to various impacts.

This Indiegogo project is targeted to raise AUD $1,500,000 to enable us to mobilise the submersibles and other research platforms and to begin operation of the C-SEA project with missions at sea. We have funded our efforts to date with substantial amounts of our own money to acquire the necessary equipment, put together a team of experienced personnel and support real, credible ocean science. We are now seeking your support to begin the collection of vital unbiased data where it’s most needed. Our goal is to commence ongoing year-round scientific operations around the areas of proposed port expansions and developments that are currently under significant public and media pressure, as well as within areas of the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area that are of concern under the investigation by the UNESCO World Heritage Committee and the International Union for Conservation of Nature. We will be inviting world-renowned scientists as well as post-graduates and students to come onboard for our expeditions in which they will gain free access to our capabilities and equipment in order to achieve our joint research goals.

How You Can Help

Our Project is a substantial undertaking and requires the same scale of funding, but every donation, no matter how big or small, is extremely helpful to us! We appreciate and rely on those of you who can only contribute in our small categories just as much as those who can afford more. Every dollar you are able to donate will get us more time on the water, and in turn give our oceans a better chance at a having a healthy future!

Your generous contributions will help us to mobilize the submersibles and get started immediately so that baseline sampling can begin before activities of potential impact to these environments commence. In return for your kind donations we are offering some very unique "Perks" that will actively involve and keep our contributors up to date with our project and its operations. There is even the opportunity to learn how to pilot a deep-sea submersible!

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute donations to our cause, but you can still be a huge help to us! Please share our story and project through your social media and email accounts, spread the word of this Indiegogo campaign with others who would also be interested in what we are doing and who would want to help us, and make some noise to ensure that we can all look forward to a future with healthy oceans to enjoy and explore.

We are confident in our objectives and believe that interested companies and organisations will become industry partners in the near future, and will follow your exemplary lead by providing ongoing financial support for this important collection of fundamental unbiased scientific data. Your generous contributions will help us to get this vital research underway before it's too late and will pave the way for our future programs to be sponsored by industry.

Thank you for your interest in our project and for helping in anyway you can. Please spread the word and help us raise the funds necessary for this critical research!
story_txt:
Project Summary
Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is at the centre
of global attention and concern due to evidence of declining health of the reef
and its ecosystems. Current plans call for expansion and development of ports
and industrial facilities within the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area and
surrounding it, adding to the concerns related to impacts from natural causes.
At Australian Oceanographics we have prepared a major scientific research
program to be at sea year round collecting critical data to help preserve,
protect and better manage these outstanding natural habitats. We are proud to
be seeking your help to achieve this goal and hope to make it a global mission
to better understand and preserve our oceans.
To launch this mission, we recently completed a
full refit of two deep-sea manned submersibles in USA, for use in our scientific
programs within the Great Barrier Reef and around Australia. Manned research
submersibles have never before been based in Australia for dedicated research
of the nation's vast ocean environments and their natural assets. Funding for this
project will be used to immediately bring the submersibles to Australia and to begin
collecting critical baseline data in the areas where marine ecosystems are most
likely to be impacted before major developments take place. Our team has
assembled the scientific equipment platforms, secured a dedicated research
vessel and is ready to begin a series of major research programs aiming to fill
information gaps and uncover the unknowns of our oceans. Now all we need is
your generous support to fund this major project and help us create a promising
future for our oceans.While our Funding Goal is a significant target that we'd love to achieve and reaching it would allow us to run our C-SEA campaign with ongoing time at sea, we will be able to utilise all contributions whether or not the target is reached.



Who We Are & What We Do


Our company, Australian Oceanographics,
strives to develop and provide cutting edge marine and oceanographic research
tools and equipment to scientists in Australia. 
The scientific expertise already exists in
Australia, however there is commonly not enough funding for these researchers
to acquire or lease the necessary scientific tools to carry out world-class
investigations and experiments in Australia's true last frontier, its oceans.
We are addressing this critical gap in
scientific capability by providing researchers with free access to the underwater equipment
that they cannot afford or acquire. Our primary objective is to bring
scientifically capable manned submersibles to Australia to expand oceanographic
and marine research capabilities, and to enable scientists to carry out
world-class investigations. Along with dedicated manned submersibles we are
compiling a range of various innovative and hi-tech equipment to perform groundbreaking
studies in Australia’s vast oceans. Scientists are also encouraged to come to
us when they identify fundamental research topics but there is no current technology
to sufficiently carry out those studies. In this case, we work with the
researchers to develop new innovative equipment to help them succeed in their
goals. Whatever the needs of the scientists, we pride ourselves in making the
technologies freely available to their studies and contributing towards our own
research programs.
Our company was established in 2006,
founded by two trained scientists that recognized this substantial gap in
Australian marine and oceanographic research capabilities. We are based in
southeast Queensland, for it's ideal location along the east coast of Australia
allowing easy access to the Great Barrier Reef and its associated natural
resources, as well as being close to the high density city areas.
We have already secured two DeepWorker 2000
manned submersibles with our crew successfully completing a full refit of both
subs to enhance their operational and scientific capability. We have also served
as the primary Industry Partner for the “Deep Australia” ARC (Australian
Research Council) grant in collaboration with The University of Queensland (UQ),
and other leading institutes around the world. The Deep Australia project
successfully developed and operated innovative “Research Camera Lander” systems
and other innovative equipment. Continuing on from the successes of this grant,
we have agreed with UQ to continue working on the Deep Australia project even
though government funding for the project has now finished. Collaborations like
this with UQ and other institutes will continue and are critical for processing
and publishing the data and results that will arise from our efforts in years
to come.
Australian Oceanographics now needs your help to
kick off a major oceanographic research and monitoring project!


The Project


With Australia’s population growing and our
major city centres expanding along the coastlines, marine ecosystems are under
a continual pressure to cope with the impacts of development, resource
exploitation, recreation and natural catastrophes. Australian Oceanographics
has prepared a long-term ecosystem monitoring and investigation program
utilizing our innovative scientific platforms and technologies to compile
comprehensive baseline data along Australia’s eastern coast. 


Under recent review by
UNESCO (for more information, visit: http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/154 ) the Australian Government has submitted a report in
January 2014 on the current state of the Great Barrier Reef’s conservation and management.
 This report describes the current
conditions and knowledge gaps of the GBR, demonstrates the management steps
already in place and outlines the future objectives and targets for the GBR conservation
as the World’s primary custodian of the Reef. A full copy of the report is publicly
available (http://www.environment.gov.au/resource/state-party-report-state-conservation-great-barrier-reef-world-heritage-area-australia-2014
). Australian Oceanographics has actively participated in the many public
comment phases related to the preparation of this report and others. Our
approach is independent of the Australian Government and associated groups, but
our efforts are collaborative and we always strive to support and contribute to
the work of Governmental agencies, Universities and other not for profit
organizations.

The C-SEA (Continental-Shelf of Eastern
Australia) program is the flagship project for Australian Oceanographics and
makes up a long-term scientific plan to explore, map and study the marine
ecosystems of our ‘backyard’. Examining the coastal and offshore waters of the
continental shelf from Cape York, Queensland, to as far south as Sydney, New
South Wales, the project aims to provide critical unbiased baseline
environmental data to increase our knowledge and understanding of the marine
ecosystems found off our coasts, including a focus on the Great Barrier Reef. The  rapidly increasing populations along
eastern Australia’s coastline along with our reliance on the oceans for
recreation and economic gain are putting immense pressures on these ecosystems
that we know little about. We will work in partnership with Australian
scientists and international collaborators to focus on current knowledge gaps
and collect critical baseline data to better inform management and
decision-makers, and to increase awareness for all those who are affected by
changes in Australia’s oceans.
The primary research goals of the C-SEA
program are to:


Collect critical baseline
environmental data, which includes documentation of habitat types and
ecosystems, organism biodiversity, species identification and abundance, as
well as monitoring water quality.
Survey the sea floor along eastern
Australia’s continental shelf using high-resolution equipment to increase
detailed topographic/bathymetric data.


Prepare detailed maps to provide a better
understanding of what seafloor structures and ecosystems are present in
our deep-sea and ocean environments. Seafloor mapping also allows for much
more efficient and precise operations of underwater vehicles in relatively
unknown or previously uncharted environments.


Survey unexplored areas and
identify the organisms and ecosystems found within them as well as locate and
highlight any historical or culturally significant artefacts.









Performing these fundamental investigations and
focusing on areas of natural or scientific significance, proposed industrial
and urban developments, high resource potential and regions under threat by
natural or human-induced impacts, will enable all of us to better understand
the state of our oceans and how to manage their conservation appropriately and
sustainably. Our commitment to be at sea year-round performing recurring studies of the same areas and
environments at appropriate intervals over time, will allow researchers to
broaden their understanding of the natural cycles of environments and how
habitats and organisms react to various impacts.


This Indiegogo project is targeted
to raise AUD $1,500,000 to enable us to mobilise the submersibles and other
research platforms and to begin operation of the C-SEA project with missions at
sea. We have funded our efforts to date with substantial amounts of our own
money to acquire the necessary equipment, put together a team of experienced
personnel and support real, credible ocean science. We are now seeking your
support to begin the collection of vital unbiased data where it’s most needed. Our
goal is to commence ongoing year-round scientific operations around the areas of proposed port expansions
and developments that are currently under significant public and media
pressure, as well as within areas of the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area
that are of concern under the investigation by the UNESCO World Heritage
Committee and the International Union for Conservation of Nature. We will be inviting world-renowned scientists as
well as post-graduates and students to come onboard for our expeditions in
which they will gain free access to our capabilities and equipment in order to
achieve our joint research goals.



How You Can Help

Our Project is a substantial undertaking and requires the same scale of funding, but every donation, no matter how big or small, is extremely helpful to us! We appreciate and rely on those of you who can only contribute in our small categories just as much as those who can afford more. Every dollar you are able to donate will get us more time on the water, and in turn give our oceans a better chance at a having a healthy future!
Your generous contributions will help us to
mobilize the submersibles and get started immediately so that baseline sampling
can begin before activities of potential impact to these environments commence. In return for your kind donations we are offering some very unique "Perks" that will actively involve and keep our contributors up to date with our project and its operations. There is even the opportunity to learn how to pilot a deep-sea submersible!
We understand that not everyone is able to contribute donations to our cause, but you can still be a huge help to us! Please share our story and project through your social media and email accounts, spread the word of this Indiegogo campaign with others who would also be interested in what we are doing and who would want to help us, and make some noise to ensure that we can all look forward to a future with healthy oceans to enjoy and explore.
We are confident in our objectives and believe that interested companies and organisations will become industry partners in the near future, and will follow your exemplary lead by providing ongoing financial support for this important collection of fundamental unbiased scientific data. Your generous contributions will help us to get this vital research underway before it's too late and will pave the way for our future programs to be sponsored by industry.
Thank you for your interest in our project and for helping in anyway you can. Please
spread the word and help us raise the funds necessary for this critical research!

story:
Inquinamen(t)o Project

The “Inquinamen(t)o” Project aims at increasing the awareness of people in Italy about the current state of water pollution in the region of Veneto (North Italy). The water pollution in object is due to the leakage of PFAS (polluting agent) in the groundwater.
In 2013 ARPAV (Veneto regional environmental prevention and protection agency) and the Italian national health system started to investigate the case and its possible consequences on food and population. An important public health screening programme, both on human health and food, is currently underway. Our project will facilitate the access on those results once the screening activities, carried out by public health services, will be completed.
The project consists of an awareness campaign based on the production and promotion of a short motion graphic video. The short cartoon will be posted on the social media and screened during relevant events. The video will increase the awareness about water pollution, providing easy access to related materials and spreading information and facts that are scientific and legally proven.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The contribution is intended to finance the production of a video in motion graphics. The video will be design and created by professional supplier. 

The Campaign Goal Amount reported in the platform is to half the total cost of the video. This sum will allow us to start the production of the video. To finance the whole video we will use additional forms of fundraising.
Based on the paid amount, you will get a our  personal gratitude and certain level of visibility within the video.

 

The impact

  • Number of municipalities involved: 21
  • Number of citizens involved: 126.927
  • Number of citizens who take advantage of the aqueduct: 109.029
  • Range of age for citizens eligible for the health screening: 14 yo – 65 yo
  • Number of citizens eligible for the screening: 84.795
  • Expected participation to the screening campaign: 59.356 (70%)
  • Successful track record: the initiative moves from a previous experience of video production (aimed at increasing the participation of the voters) that reached over 150,000 people

story:
I am running the half marathon on behalf of Stakeholder Democracy Network, a human and environmental rights charity that  strives to protect human rights and demand responsive governance in the Niger Delta, Nigeria.

SDN's  mission is to support the efforts of those affected by extractive industries and weak governance through rights based community empowerment. 


What does SDN do in the Niger Delta


"The Niger Delta is a region suffering from administrative neglect, crumbling social infrastructure and services, high unemployment, social deprivation, abject poverty, filth and squalor, and endemic conflict."

The Niger Delta fuels Nigeria's heavily oil-dependent economy and accounts for 95% of Nigeria's export earnings and over 80% of Federal Government revenue. However, this region remains one of the poorest parts of the country. 

The extreme neglect of Human Rights and Governance from all levels of Government is endemic throughout the region. 

Billions of dollars from oil revenues have been distributed unequally and have not translated into development and basic services for the population. 

The majority of the Niger Delta inhabitants lack access to basic infrastructure, health and education services as well as job opportunities. High levels of pollution and destruction of traditional means of livelihood increase the vulnerability to poverty in the region. The fundamental conditions of extreme deprivation have remained unchanged for decades and drive cycles of violent conflict.

SDN's two organisational pillars of research and advocacy, supported by two core tools of capacity building and pilot projects help facilitate communities and civil society to communicate a shared vision and negotiate with other stakeholders, to get a better deal from the investments and operations that affect their lives, livelihoods and environment.


SDN believes that empowered communities can become the agents of change and uphold their basic socio-political and economic rights. 

SDN helps communities to become knowledgeable, confident, inclusive, organized and able to participate in and influence decision- making to improve their lives.

The Impact

Poor operating practices, weak law enforcement and an active illegal oil economy contribute to hundreds of oil spills a year in the Niger Delta.


This environmental disaster destroys traditional livelihoods, breeds mistrust and resentment and undermines the operational security of oil companies and Federal Government.


SDN recognises the importance of building the capacity of citizens and civil society in all areas of their work. 



£10 donations can contribute to funding communities based training in rural areas of Rivers, Delta and Bayelsa State in response to this national emergency. 


Larger donations can support community groups to identify a multi-stakeholder process that streamlines regulations, reduces incentives for the illegal oil economy and ensures global standards are enforced.


Thank you for reading, for more information check out http://www.stakeholderdemocracy.org


or support SDN's progress on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/SDN-Stakeholder-...

story:
HELP US SAVE THE EAGLES

A big number of Black and Chestnut Eagles have been hunted and killed in Colombia due to their poultry behavior, illegal wildlife trade and deforestation. The main causes of the population's decline of this eagles. Precisely due to habitat loss and hunting pressure, the Black and Chestnut eagle is classified as Endangered (EN) in Colombia and worldwide.

Many of the attacked eagles survive the shooting, because of the lack of resources they are not being transported quickly to the rehab center for medical and rehabilitation procedures. Rehabilitating  these individuals is essential for the preservation of the Black and Chestnut Eagle, besides having a small population, their reproduction rate is really slow (1 egg every 2 years). A very few population of humans in Colombia know about this eagle and its condition. Their biology is not really well known.

Our project's goal is to conserve the Black and Chestnut Eagle in Colombia through rehabilitation, environmental education and biological research.

Rehabilitation

In our Rehabilitation Center of Birds of Prey CRARSI, we have the logistics and technical capacity to rehabilitate these birds. However, we need resources to transport the wounded animals quickly to our center to start all the process. We would also monitor the eagles after their liberation to their natural enviroment.

Enviromental Education

To ensure the safety of the eagles, we need to generate changes in perceptions and negative local's attitudes.  During educational campaigns we would have the support of a female Black and Chestnut Eagle that was rescued and can't be release. (picture below)

story:
Supported by the CRÉDIL (Comité Régional d'Éducation pour le Développement International de Lanaudière) and by QSF (Quebec Sans Frontières), a team of 10 people from Quebec will be spending 75 days in Baback, Senegal.

 

About Baback Sérère: 

- Approx. 80 km east of Dakar, 15 km south of Thiès.

- 2 000 inhabitants

- Language: Sérère Sine

 

The project’s main goal is to help the local community build a more sustainable agriculture using the tools and ideas of Permaculture. By joining forces with local association of 150 women, we will listen to the main needs of the people, discover the environment, and start building a sustainable village with a responsible community. 

By the people, for the people.

We hope to provide you with a documentary we will be working on during our stay in Senegal.

Thank you very much for your contribution.

Sari Hawa, and the whole Senegal2013 Team

 

 

 

Grace au CRÉDIL (Comité Régional d'Éducation pour le Développement International de Lanaudière) et à QSF (Québec Sans Frontières), une équipe de 10 personnes passera 75 jours à Baback, au Sénégal.

 

À propos de Baback Sérère :

- à environ 80 km à l’Est de Dakar, 15 km au sud de Thiès.

- 2 000 habitants

- Langue : Sérère Sine

 

Le but principal du projet est d’aider la communauté locale à bâtir une agriculture plus durable en utilisant les principes et les outils de la Permaculture. C’est à travers un regroupement de 150 femmes du village que nous aborderons le défi, en découvrant leurs besoins, en étudiant la région, et en unissant nos forces et connaissances pour bâtir un village durable et une communauté responsable. 

Par le peuple, pour le peuple.

Nous espérons pouvoir vous offrir un documentaire sur lequel nous travaillerons durant notre séjour au Sénégal.

Merci beaucoup pour votre contribution. 

Sari Hawa, et l’équipe Senegal2013.

story:
Ayúdenos a crear opciones de empleo y desarrollo en la zona de Los Santos, Costa Rica

El Proyecto Cultura Verde

¡Hola! Somos Cultura Verde, una iniciativa liderada por tres mujeres profesionales quienes unimos nuestros conocimientos de agricultura orgánica, arte, cultura y gastronomía para crear este proyecto ambicioso.

Nuestro centro de operaciones está en El Casquillo, una finca orgánica localizada en las montañas cafetaleras de Los Santos en Costa Rica.  http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde

Trabajamos con grupos de las comunidades locales ayudándoles a realizar proyectos de desarrollo que generen nuevas fuentes de empleo en la zona. Nos enfocamos en 3 áreas temáticas:

  • agricultura orgánica (biointensiva)
  • arte (incluyendo arte-terapia)

  • cultura (vinculado al turismo)

 ¿Para qué necesitamos su colaboración?

Necesitamos recaudar como mínimo $25.000 dólares para mejorar nuestra infraestructura y ampliar las instalaciones que tenemos para poder realizar los eventos culturales, talleres y capacitaciones, y acoger más gente.

El dinero recolectado se destinará a:

  • Acondicionar y equipar la cocina y comedor (mesas de trabajo, muebles, cocina, horno, refrigerador, mesas y sillas, utensilios de cocina, platos, manteles, cubiertos, etc.) - $3.800
  • Ponerle piso al rancho y cerrarlo con ventanas (agregaríamos unos 50 m2 de espacio cómodo para estar en las noches y días fríos) - $6.500
  • Construir un deck para los eventos públicos (agregaríamos unos 30 m2 de espacio adicional) - $7.000
  • Construir una bodega de almacenamiento para equipo, mobiliario e ingredientes – $7.000
  • Comprar equipo audiovisual, herramientas y materiales para nuestras charlas y talleres - $3.000

Realmente necesitamos contar con mejores condiciones para poder ofrecer un servicio excelente y una experiencia de disfrute y aprendizaje óptima.

El impacto sobre la comunidad

En esta zona se produce uno de los mejores cafés del mundo. Esta actividad y las cooperativas cafetaleras han traído prosperidad para muchos pero, también hay personas, sobre todo jóvenes y grupos de mujeres, que están quedando excluidos. A pesar de que hay una gran belleza natural en esta región, muchos recursos, y gente muy creativa, muchas de estas personas sienten que no tienen oportunidades.

Al ayudarles a ver y consolidar nuevas oportunidades de desarrollo, creemos que podemos crear un efecto multiplicador, no solo en lo económico sino también en la visión de futuro de cada una de estas comunidades.

Para más información visite este apartado dentro de nuestra web: http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!alianzas/c1nt5 

¿Cómo pensamos hacer sostenible este proyecto?

Para financiarnos tenemos al menos tres fuentes potenciales:

  1. La participación de la gente en nuestros eventos culturales y educativos.
  2. El aporte de las empresas privadas por medio de los programas de responsabilidad social empresarial.
  3. Los programas de apoyo cultural y ambiental del gobierno.

Para más información sobre ecoturismo responsable y donaciones visite estos apartados dentro de nuestra página web:

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!ecoturismo/c2416

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!donaciones/c79k

Cómo contribuir?

¡Le invitamos a ser parte de esta iniciativa y ayudarnos a llevar adelante este gran proyecto!

Existen muchas maneras en las que usted puede impulsar este proyecto:

  • dando dinero,
  • ofreciendo su apoyo como voluntario,
  • o simplemente pasando esto a personas en su red de contactos.

Y no se olviden de leer nuestra lista de incentivos.

¡Este proyecto necesita gente!

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde

http://www.facebook.com/proyectoculturaverde

 

Help us create development and employment alternatives in Los Santos community in Costa Rica

Cultura Verde Project

Hello! We are Cultura Verde, an initiative led by three professional women who have united our knowledge on organic agriculture, art, culture and gastronomy to create this ambitious project.

Our main operations center is located at El Casquillo, an organic farm located in the coffee farming mountains of Los Santos in Costa Rica.  http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde

We work with local community groups helping them to carry out development projects which will generate new employment options in the area. We focus on 3 topics:

  • organic agriculture (biointensive)
  • arts (including art-therapy)

  • culture (linked to tourism)

What do we need your collaboration for?

We need to raise a minimum of $25.000 USD to improve and enlarge our infrastructure in order to be able to hold cultural events, workshops, trainings and host more people.

The money will be used in:

  • Condition and equip the kitchen and dining room area (work tables, furniture, cabinets, stove, refrigerator, tables and chairs, cooking utensils, dishes and silverware, etc.) - $3.800
  • Close the ranch with windows and install a floor in it (we would add some 50 m2 of comfortable space to be at during nights and cooler days) -$6.500
  • Build a deck to host the public events (we would add some additional space of 30 m2)- $7.000
  • Build a storage room for equipment, furniture and food ingredients– $7.000
  • Buy audiovisual equipment, tools and materials for our workshops and trainings - $3.000

We really need to improve the current conditions at our center to be able to offer a better service, as well as an awesome learning and enjoyment experience for all.

The impact on the community

The Los Santos region produces some of the world’s best coffee. This coffee production and the coffee cooperatives have brought prosperity to many, but there are people, especially young people and women's groups, who are being left behind. In spite of the region’s great natural beauty, many resources, and very creative people, they don’t feel that there are opportunities for them.

Working with these groups in communities, we believe that we can help them see and take advantage of new opportunities, creating a multiplier effect, not only economically but also in these communities’ vision for their future.

For more information on this regard visit this section of our webpage: http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!alianzas/c1nt5

How will we achieve sustainability for this Project?

We have at least three sources for assuring financial support:

  1. Public participation at our cultural and educational events
  2. Support from the private industry through their corporate social responsibility programs
  3. Government cultural and environmental support grants

For more information on responsible ecotourism and donations please visit these sections in our webpage:

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!ecoturismo/c2416

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!donaciones/c79k

How can you contribute?

We invite you to be part of this initiative and help us move forward this challenging project!

There are many ways in which you can support this project:

  • giving Money,
  • offering your voluntary work,
  • or simply passing this to your network.  

And don´t forget to check out our perks list.

This Project needs people!

http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde

http://www.facebook.com/proyectoculturaverde
story_txt:
Ayúdenos a crear opciones de empleo y desarrollo en la zona de Los Santos, Costa Rica
El Proyecto Cultura Verde
¡Hola! Somos Cultura Verde, una iniciativa liderada por tres mujeres profesionales quienes unimos nuestros conocimientos de agricultura orgánica, arte, cultura y gastronomía para crear este proyecto ambicioso.
Nuestro centro de operaciones está en El Casquillo, una finca orgánica localizada en las montañas cafetaleras de Los Santos en Costa Rica.  http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde
Trabajamos con grupos de las comunidades locales ayudándoles a realizar proyectos de desarrollo que generen nuevas fuentes de empleo en la zona. Nos enfocamos en 3 áreas temáticas:

agricultura orgánica (biointensiva)
arte (incluyendo arte-terapia)

cultura (vinculado al turismo)

 ¿Para qué necesitamos su colaboración?
Necesitamos recaudar como mínimo $25.000 dólares para mejorar nuestra infraestructura y ampliar las instalaciones que tenemos para poder realizar los eventos culturales, talleres y capacitaciones, y acoger más gente.
El dinero recolectado se destinará a:


Acondicionar y equipar la cocina y comedor (mesas de trabajo, muebles, cocina, horno, refrigerador, mesas y sillas, utensilios de cocina, platos, manteles, cubiertos, etc.) - $3.800


Ponerle piso al rancho y cerrarlo con ventanas (agregaríamos unos 50 m2 de espacio cómodo para estar en las noches y días fríos) - $6.500


Construir un deck para los eventos públicos (agregaríamos unos 30 m2 de espacio adicional) - $7.000


Construir una bodega de almacenamiento para equipo, mobiliario e ingredientes – $7.000


Comprar equipo audiovisual, herramientas y materiales para nuestras charlas y talleres - $3.000

Realmente necesitamos contar con mejores condiciones para poder ofrecer un servicio excelente y una experiencia de disfrute y aprendizaje óptima.
El impacto sobre la comunidad
En esta zona se produce uno de los mejores cafés del mundo. Esta actividad y las cooperativas cafetaleras han traído prosperidad para muchos pero, también hay personas, sobre todo jóvenes y grupos de mujeres, que están quedando excluidos. A pesar de que hay una gran belleza natural en esta región, muchos recursos, y gente muy creativa, muchas de estas personas sienten que no tienen oportunidades.
Al ayudarles a ver y consolidar nuevas oportunidades de desarrollo, creemos que podemos crear un efecto multiplicador, no solo en lo económico sino también en la visión de futuro de cada una de estas comunidades.
Para más información visite este apartado dentro de nuestra web: http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!alianzas/c1nt5 
¿Cómo pensamos hacer sostenible este proyecto? 
Para financiarnos tenemos al menos tres fuentes potenciales:

La participación de la gente en nuestros eventos culturales y educativos.
El aporte de las empresas privadas por medio de los programas de responsabilidad social empresarial.
Los programas de apoyo cultural y ambiental del gobierno.
Para más información sobre ecoturismo responsable y donaciones visite estos apartados dentro de nuestra página web:
http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!ecoturismo/c2416
http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde#!donaciones/c79k
Cómo contribuir?
¡Le invitamos a ser parte de esta iniciativa y ayudarnos a llevar adelante este gran proyecto!
Existen muchas maneras en las que usted puede impulsar este proyecto:

dando dinero,
ofreciendo su apoyo como voluntario,
o simplemente pasando esto a personas en su red de contactos.
Y no se olviden de leer nuestra lista de incentivos.
¡Este proyecto necesita gente! 
http://elcasquillo.wix.com/culturaverde
http://www.facebook.com/proyectoculturaverde

campaign_city: San José/ San Pablo, León Cortés, Costa Rica

story:
We've already bought a museum, now let's build one.

In 2012, we launched an Indiegogo campaign to buy the property of Nikola Tesla’s former laboratory, located in Shoreham, New York.  The campaign needed $850,000 and we successfully raised $1.37M. With a combined grant from NY State for an additional $850K, this money was used to make a bid on the property, and the lab was SAVED.

Thanks to the 33,000+ wonderful backers who supported the cause, the non-profit behind this project now owns the property of Nikola Tesla's former laboratory at Wardenclyffe.

This initial round was enough to buy a laboratory, but not enough to actually BUILD a museum. So, earlier this year I wrote a cartoonist's review of my Tesla Model S, wherein I asked Elon Musk to donate the remaining amount needed to restore Tesla’s lab. 

Elon Musk agreed to donate $1M, in addition to building a Tesla supercharger station in the museum parking lot.

He also issued a challenge to us to try and raise the rest of the funds ourselves. This is what we're doing now. 

We're hoping to raise the funds needed to begin the removal of hazardous materials from the buildings, as well as begin the renovation of the Stanford White building, which served as the laboratory and heart of Nikola Tesla's wireless energy project known as Wardenclyffe.

We've partnered with a brick company which engraves and installs bricks used for walkways and flooring, so for as little as $125 you can get a brick engraved with your name or message and placed on the grounds of the Tesla Museum, where it will permanently reside for all time.  

That's $125 for your name to be a part of the museum forever.

We also offer bigger bricks, and a design option if you want to upload a logo or piece of artwork. 

You're welcome to upload names, messages, artwork, haikus, or poems about your cat.  Poems about your tarantula are acceptable, too.

Reserve a brick sooner rather than later

Because these bricks will physically take up space on the property, we can only sell a limited number of them, and the sooner you purchase a brick, the more likely your brick will receive a preferred placement such as near Tesla's statue and the tower base.

The sooner you back this project, the better the location of your brick on the property.

Goals

These bricks will fund needed maintenance as well as aid in the renovation of the Stanford White building, which served as Tesla's laboratory and the heart of the wireless energy tower.
We are aiming to initially raise $200,000, which will be enough to replace the roof on the most important structure on the property and protect Tesla's lab from the ravages of time and neglect. Ultimately we need to raise a figure closer to $10M, but we are planning a few different fundraisers in the future to meet this goal.

Can't afford a brick?

You can also buy a Tesla Motors / Wardenclyffe t-shirt over at TeeSpring.  
For each shirt sold, $15 goes directly to the museum.


Still want to help?

Support the project by sharing this sing-a-long video.

FAQ

How do I tell you what I want engraved on my brick?
We’re going to collect all of this information from backers when the campaign ends.

Are there any rules I should know about?

The Tesla Science Center at Wardenclyffe reserves the right of refusal of any order found to be inappropriate or in violation of the Tesla Science Center at Wardenclyffe policies, directives, or guidelines. Friends of Science East, Inc., dba Tesla Science Center at Wardenclyffe, is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, established under the laws of the State of New York. Discriminatory or inappropriate messages which refer to an individual's or group's sex, race, color, religious creed, national origin, age, or physical handicap will not be permitted.

When you sponsor a brick, your payment does not entitle you to receive any bricks, but rather is a charitable contribution to the Tesla Science Center at Wardenclyffe. For each contribution, an engraved brick will be placed on our campus. As any benefits in return for the contribution are considered "incidental," the full amount of your contribution is deductible for federal tax purposes.

How long until my brick is engraved and placed on the property?

The first bricks will be installed in the spring of 2015 in the area between the tower base and the statue of Tesla. If we have more than we need for that area, other sites on the grounds have been selected for additional installations.

The minimum of $125 is out of my price range. How else can I help?
We're also selling some awesome Tesla shirts over here, and proceeds from those shirt sales go directly to the museum.

story:
Climatologists, like other scientists...are far more comfortable in our laboratories or gathering data in the field than we are giving interviews to journalists or speaking before Congressional committees. Why then are climatologists speaking out about the dangers of global warming? The answer is that virtually all of us are now convinced that global warming poses a clear and present danger to civilization.

             -- Lonnie Thompson, Ohio State paleoclimatologist, 2010

Sometimes doing your best is not good enough. Sometimes you must do what is required. 

            -- Winston Churchill


The Climate Mobilization is a growing group of people who know that climate change threatens the collapse of civilization within this century. We believe, along with many well-respected scientists and environmental analysts, that the only way to preserve a climate that is safe, stable, and supportive of human civilization is to fight climate change with a  World War II-scale mobilization.

The Pledge to Mobilize - a political platform and social movement strategy - is a tool that can make this possible.

  (View our slideshow for an  overview!)


Signers publicly acknowledge climate change as a threat to civilization and call on the US Federal Government to instigate a WWII scale mobilization to fight back. Signers pledge their support to politicians who have also signed the Pledge, and, critically, promise to spread the Pledge to others-- their friends, family, and communities. In this way the Pledge is both a democracy re-boot and a viral strategy. 

The Pledge was designed to overcome psychological, cultural, and technological barriers to engagement in order to make the climate crisis real for people and bring about a cultural transformation.

  1. Commence a five-year mobilization, on the scale of the WWII home front mobilization,  to preserve a climate that is safe, stable, and supportive of human civilization. 
  2. Reduce national carbon emissions by at least 76% in 5 years, at a rate of no less than 25% per year.
  3. Create a Climate Mobilization Corps, tens of millions strong, which will implement adaptation measures and rapidly expand our post-carbon energy infrastructure and agricultural systems.
  4. Conduct this mobilization in accordance with the Constitution, and ensure that the essential needs of the civilian economy are met during this transition. 
  5. Exert diplomatic and international pressure to enlist allied nations in this heroic fight against social, economic, and environmental chaos. 
**Full Pledge text available in the gallery**


Perhaps this strikes you as a pie-in-the-sky platform. We fully acknowledge, given the current political climate of passivity, willful ignorance, denial and stalemate, that our demands are "unrealistic" in the narrow sense of the word.  That's why the Pledge to Mobilize is also a social movement strategy designed to leverage massive public support for a scientifically tenable mobilization platform.

The Pledge's demands are not idle words. 


Signing the Pledge to Mobilize commits you to supporting political candidates, on the local, state, and national level, who have also signed the Pledge. This creates a challenge, and an opportunity, for sitting politicians and their opponents: Will they sign? Will they acknowledge that climate change threatens the collapse of civilization and muster the courage to fight back? As more people take the Pledge, it will become an ever more effective political tool. 


This is not another internet petition. You can't just "take" the Pledge online. It has to be given to you by someone who has already taken it. This "person to person" method of spreading encourages people to discuss climate change with their friends, family, and communities.  

Signers spread the Pledge to people they respect and care about. 


Climate change is often avoided as a topic of conversation, in large part because it makes people feel scared and helpless. But the Pledge changes that equation. The Pledge provides a frame for discussions about climate change that are scary, but also realistically hopeful. We can fight this crisis and every one of us can contribute. 

The Pledge is a flexible strategy. 

Pledgers can host events at their homes, or in the community. They can organize local lectures and discussions about the climate crisis and the Climate Mobilization. Religious people can spread the Pledge in their communities of worship, and climate educators can offer the Pledge after their presentations. The Climate Mobilization can have booths at farmers’ markets, staffed by Pledge signers, who will offer frank conversations about climate change, the need for a mobilization, and the Pledge as a tool to get us there. 

Spreading the Pledge can transform our culture of denial into one of truth, courage, and active engagement.


Rather than finding a "politically realistic" solution that does not address the scientific realities and cannot prevent the collapse of civilization, our goal is to fundamentally alter what is realistic. Spreading the Pledge can instigate millions of conversations about climate change, fostering a culture of dedicated emergency response. The media will stop asking politicians, “Do you believe in climate change?” and start asking them, “Will you fight for civilization or not?”

  1. View our slideshow for an  overview of the Climate Mobilization and the Pledge to Mobilize.
  2. Read our strategy document Rising to the Challenge of Our Time, Together for a thorough description of our plans and strategy.
  3. Visit the Gallery to see a mockup of the website we want to build, as well as the full text of the Pledge.

We are ready to start spreading the Pledge to Mobilize. But we need help.

By raising only $20,000 we will be able to launch the Pledge to Mobilize nationally.  Your donation will help us get there. We will use (approximately):

  •  $10,000 on programming 
  •  $6,000 on design
  •  $1,000 for legal and miscellaneous expenses, such as web hosting
  •  $3,000 to keep in the bank for unanticipated costs that come with launch.

**NB The Climate Mobilization is a 501c(4) Non-Profit. This status allows us to pursue a political agenda. Unfortunately, however, it means that donations are not tax deductible.**

Our initial goal is to help the 5.4 million Americans who are "alarmed" about climate change mobilize themselves with maximum efficacy. Our ultimate goal is a climate that is safe, stable, and supportive of human civilization. We hope that you donate, that you work with us, and that you sign the Pledge and mobilize with us!

story:
(The picture above is of Rachel's cabin)

So what's this all about?

In July of this year I will be celebrating my 40th Birthday. Some of you will recall Rachel's garden party a few years ago, when we celebrated the opening of the Log Cabin (not her 40th of course). That has been the inspiration for my birthday present and the reason for this fund raiser.

The children have grown up a bit since the Playhouse was built, with the help of Neil, and it has seen better days. The adjacent pond, which despite being able to sustain life, holds surprisingly little water and is in constant need of blanket weed and crud removal.

To mark my birthday I plan to re-dig the pond and construct a garden cabin next to it.

 

What will I need?

A concrete base upon which to build.

Some pond liner to line the new pond once dug.

Some time off work to get it all done.

 

What will you get?

To avoid having to go shopping for me.

The knowledge that you will be contributing towards something that will mark the occasion for years to come.

My gratitude.

 

Thankyou in advance for your kind contributions towards by birthday present. We will look forward to having a party to show it all off, I hope, later in the year.

Daniel x

story:
We are Esme and Jesse. We're 9 year old twins. Our mom and dad are taking a sabatical year to show us the beauty of the different cultures, languages and islands of the Caribbean. But to also show us first-hand the effects of climate change.

We want to visit the island nations in the eastern Caribbean and would like to report on the health of the marine environment from kids' perspectives. We would like to engage other kids in caring about the marine environment because the actions and attitudes today affect the quality of all young people's lives the most.

Your contributions will help us spread the message about global climate change, and how it is affecting island nations around the world. From rising sea levels threatening poor nations to bleaching coral reefs and collapsing eco-systems due to warming oceans.

We would like to produce a documentary of the passage and already have some of the equipment needed. However, we need specialized equipment to film, edit and produce to the quality level that can draw a larger audience for our message. Submersible cameras, microphones etc. would deliver much higher quality than the equipment we have now. We would like to make it appealing for schools to show in classrooms. So your help would be really appreciated!

If you cannot contribute, please support us by liking our Aqualibra facebook page and using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you,

Esme & Jesse

story:
The Overview

We are a team of 6 students from the University of Exeter and Falmouth University studying towards Conservation, Zoology and Photography degrees respectively. 

Our aim is to compare the reptile and amphibian populations at 2 sites within Zahamena National Park in Madagascar. These surveys have rarely been done in this area, and information is lacking for many of the parks reptile and amphibian species.


This expedition will allow researchers and conservation practitioners to understand more about the species in the area, which can then enable them and their habitats to be protected.


With your help we can make a contribution to science which could potentially save some of Madagascar's species from going extinct.

The Expedition Background

Zahamena National Park is one of the most inaccesable protected areas in Madagascar, and so does not get a lot of attraction from tourism. This is both bad and good, as although it means less destructive impacts from tourists it also means the park gains less money for protection.


Our expedition hopes to raise awareness of what can be found in Zahamena National Park, through blogs, photographs and a short documentary. All of these will be available through our facebook page: Discover Zahamena 2014


Madagascar is home to some of the highest levels of endemism in the world, this means that species found in Madagascar cannot be found anywhere else, making the conservation of these species and habitats important. Zahamena National Park is home to 46 reptile and 62 amphibian species, all of which are under threat from logging and encroachment from lowland farming communities.


Our research will enable us to pinpoint which species are present within the park, and collect important data about habitat preferences, physiological appearance and diversity of species for 2 areas within Zahamena National Park.

How can you help?

With your help, we will build invaluable links with the University in Antananarivo, as well as the Zahamena National Park authorities. This will make it easier for expeditions to go to Zahamena in the future, and build upon the data we have already collected.


We have already secured a grant from the Gilchrist Educational Trust, and have each made a personal contribution of £750 towards the cost of the expedition. With your help we can reach our goal of £15,000 which will help us to cover the cost of scientific equipment, food and salaries of local guides which are invaluable on any expedition, medical training for all team members, travel within Madagascar, research permits, flights and much more.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can make a donation, but we would still be grateful of your support for our expedition!


Please share the word to everyone you know about our campaign, and all of our social media outlets, it would mean the world to us!


Facebook: Discover Zahamena 2014

Twitter: @zahamena14

Blog: FXpeditions
